content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
THE WALKING DEAD, SEASON 1Wow! What a grand Interactive TV show that is better than the rest!By and large, most choice-driven games have followed the same formula, inviting you to make your mark in the world by deciding if you want to be “good” or “bad,” and accepting the binary nature of existence. But in the post-apocalyptic world of The Walking Dead, where the dead walk the decaying earth, the notion of good and bad is somewhat dated. There’s no “right” when right can mean shooting an innocent child before it can turn into a flesh-eating beast, and there’s no “wrong” when wrong can mean stealing the supplies you need to survive from those just as needy as you. The Walking Dead is the story of the choices you can’t live with, and the choices you can, coming together to create an experience as depressing and pessimistic as it is remarkable and memorable. This game will linger like a good book.Zombies with a great storyIn stark contrast to the rest of gaming, The Walking Dead is more focused on what you do than how you do it. There aren’t many traditional puzzles as much as there are tasks that you’re asked to perform to move the story forward. Menial activities like finding batteries for a radio or starting up a train aren’t all that engaging by themselves, but they serve a very necessary pacing purpose, as well as give you a chance to explore the world a bit and get to know the characters better. If you’re looking to rampage around Georgia blasting the heads off of undead monsters, you’re better getting one of the many other zombie games on the market. L4D comes to mind.Compaired to the other Interactive gamesI have played many interactive types of video games and WDS1 IS THE BEST! No doubt about it. Very satisfying.AND REMEMBER: A Zombie outbreak could be prevented if people were buried with their shoe laces tied together. :D

number of helpful: 12 of 14 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												If there's a genre I avoid like the plague (excuse pun!), it's zombies - so I've really not even bothered reading reviews about The Walking Dead - my mistake right there.  So, here I am reeling from a game with quite possibly more feels in it than the entire legendary series of Mass Effect (pure videogame blasphemy, that).  Yet, I was only tempted into buying The Walking Dead by its namesake Pinball FX2 table where scoring choices declared that I'd chosen to 'save' one person or another (I just wanted to find out what all that was about...).  How mistaken I was to think this was some kind of zombie FPS!For fellow gamers who hate zombies, let me put this out there: this game is not actually about zombies.  With a title of "The Walking Dead" and a zillion screenshots of, well, zombies - I might sound like I'm off my rocker here, but no.  An unexplained disease outbreak has suddenly taken place (you never get to find out what, how or why in the game) which results in the dead returning to devour the flesh of anything they can grab (yep, sounds suspiciously zombie-like, doesn't it?) but this is really just the backdrop to the storyline.  The backdrop event could equally be about a nuclear holocaust, or some killer virus outbreak (kinda not far off this story actually).  It is the events caused by this cataclysmic, life-changing backdrop that you play through.  The game is a story-rich masterpiece about survival.  You will constantly be presented with moral choices and difficult dilemmas.  Do you trust fellow survivors or not?  Do you depend on them?  Do you let a threat live?  Do you let compassion rule over logic?  Do you be honest or withold the brutal truth from a child?  In truth, you might do a little of all these things because this is a game with very few rights versus wrongs.  There is little point flipping through walk-throughs in hope of pursuing the perfect game.  It simply doesn't work like that.  You will be presented with tear-jerking choices where neither is great, but you HAVE to choose.  Heartbreaking moments surface throughout - so all but the most hardened of players might appreciate a box of Kleenex by their side!  This game is very much the 8-person lifeboat scenario where you forever always seem to have 9 people.  Who goes?  YOU decide.  But not everyone can live happily ever after and life is not always fair...I don't know how true to the comics the game happens to be, but I will say that the characters were very easy to care about (even the dislikeable ones had a story), the artwork is novel and effective (somehow 3D without losing the water-colour comic essence), and the haunting melodic music throughout sets the tone for the dark storyline perfectly.  The game plays well with both keyboard/mouse and gamepad and doesn't require a ninja PC to play it (which is always nice).  There are no pointless 'collectibles' missions to detract from the story and no quick-save options to dilute the pressure of the instant-decision process (though for busy people it is never-the-less possible to rewind back to an earlier point if part of the story is missed).  For anyone who enjoys a great story-driven adventure built strongly upon the choices you make throughout each episode, this game is the real deal.  If you want a game where what you do really seems to matter, and where a few shocks and anguishes won't be too distressing, then I highly recommend this game.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												A powerful story I got to experience, not just observe.In an era of games about survival, The Walking Dead examines both your heart and mind, not just your trigger finger.Will you protect yourself from threats by any means or will you try to keep your humanity? Who will you help and who will you hurt? Sometimes, even if you do your best, the worst will still come afterwards. While not a fan of the TV series and never having read the comics, I found myself immediately immersed in the world of this game and connected with the different characters. It felt like I had to think and react in near real time. The choices I could make were often far from ideal and the conflict affected me deeply. At times my heart was lifted and many it was broken. A brilliant story with gameplay that isn't about winning, but introspection. I don't feel I can say more than what's been said about this game by others, just add myself to the collective of people who think they experienced something exceptional. Any perceived flaws are slight blemishes that can be easily looked past due to the many highlights this game offers and the total refinement of the story, in my opinion.

												I don't write reviews. I feel it's a waste of time and effort but I felt a need to do one for The Walking Dead.The stylized graphics look really great to me. For the times I noticed it, the music is great and perfectly matches what you're looking at. Gameplay is your typical point and click but with keyboard movement controls and QTEs thrown in which works well. All these make for a mediocre game if not for the story which is what makes this game the masterpiece that it is.All that being said, I hate this game. I only recommend this to get as many people as possible to suffer with me.The game will constantly put you in situations you do not want to be in and force you to make hard decisions. Many times I wanted to stand up and walk away but the game will suck you in and compel you to keep going through its many screwed-up events. We're talking about "A Song of Ice and FIre" level of screwed-up. You find yourself loving the characters and hating some but one thing you won't be able to do is be indifferent. Even the most passive gamer would find him/herself emotionally invested. I was an unwilling participant and fought as hard as I could against the poignant and visceral feelings the game stirs up but broke down at the very end.I play games for amusement and entertainment, I was neither amused nor entertained but was powerless to stop myself from seeing the game through. The last time I felt this way was when I watched "Grave of Fireflies" the first time and I had to watch reruns of Modern Family and Big Bang Theory over the next few days to recover. I am currently steeling myself before firing up Season 2 and was advised to get Tales From the Borderlands as a possible antidote after.TL;DR: A masterpiece. 10/10. Will never play again. Play it and taste bitter regret afterwards. Avoid if depressive, do not play if suicidal.

Product received for free
												The Walking Dead is a game point and click genre of horror based on the comics of the same name created by Robert Kirkman. Since the game was developed and published by Telltale Games with release date on 24 April 2012. In fact, the game itself can be considered an "interactive cinematic" where more watch than play, but even so it does not takes the most important sense: decisions.We must face many difficult and very stressful situations, perhaps the time is regarded as the greatest enemy that the player can have. After all, every choice is a totally different answer and even when we remain silent (there is the "..." or when the time runs out choice) it might mean something. Can strengthen friendships or create enemies, but perhaps what is more cruel to anyone who plays or is the explicit violence, for the most part, but the decision of who should help. In the beginning, all are strangers and it's just a game any, but as time passes you can know them better and to create affection for each of them or even depending on the situation you can create anger and try everything to take revenge someone who was bad for both you, Lee Everett, and for Clementine. This tie the player creates with the main characters is something indescribable and eventually becomes so strong that at times you might end up crying. When walking story, choices as who stays and who goes, and who enters the group may be common and really dangerous, after all are not what they claim to be.The game's story is quite cliche, try to survive in a world full of zombies, and despite all the harm they caused, can not compare to what humans can do to satisfy your survival instinct. But the game can develop the plot in a way that I consider exquisite, creating a differential and an incredible depth, highlighting even more the series and comic.Things that caught my attention in particular:- Trama completely engaging and full of twists.- Striking characters and well worked, mostly.- The quality of animation is equivalent to the designer of the comic.- The choices affect the continuation of the game.- Great emotional load that can affect the player an indescribable way, the amazing thing is that we end up creating a special affection by the protagonists.TWD no doubt is a remarkable and unforgettable game with an amazing story and simple gameplay. Perhaps the only game of the problem is the lack of difficulty, but perhaps this is more a matter of accessibility and so those who want to just "see" can take the course also, without fear of "suffering". What I find most impressive is how this game can shake the sentimental and the ease that he has to become admired by those who have the pleasure of playing. There should be no doubt why the game has won the GOTY in 2012, after a masterpiece like this should receive their deserved recognition.For similar Steamified Reviews and Giveaways, please visit http://www.steamified.com/ .Also you're welcome to join in the fun in our Steamified group.

Posted: May 6, 2016
												when i first played this game ( episode 1) i was like what is this game ?!! lol looks dumb (first time i ever heard of the walking dead also Telltale ) boy was i wrong,30 min after that i was like HELL i need the second episode ASAP ( had to wait a month for the second episode to come out) now good thing you got the full game + the dlc ( took me 20 h to complete it without the dlc) .- first of all the plot : (the best thing you get in this game) the story is divided to 5 episodes ( back in 2012 you had to wait and pay for each episode but now you get the whole thing ) your decisions and choices will affect the main plot event in season 2 which i think its the best thing you can ask in a video game ( cause it feels like you're actually live the story not just playing ) also there is not right or wrong , bad or good decisions you just have to do what you think is best ( like in real life) ohh you will meet some people from the TV show like glenn and hershel.- graphically : the devs choices to make the game looks like a 3D/comic art style ( like in the comics i guess ) witch is great considering the origin of the game .-now the gameplay : like any other point and click game you walk with WASD and the mouse to look around and to select or grab stuff + QTE when it comes to fight ( sometimes to gotta be quick making decision)-sound: perfect voice acting ( really get in to you when the game gets emotional) + a lot of dialogue , music and sound effects are great .-no multy of course ( duhhh) but after each episode , the game with compare your choses to other players around the world and show you the statistics so you can see how people played games like this one ( also in the end of the game)-bugs or glitches : sometimes characters and items glitches in the game and sometimes they becomes invisible but doesn't crash or block the progression in the game( maybe something to do with windows 10 or my pc who knows).-achievements : 48 easy achievements for achievements hunters like myself ( story related you just have to play the game to unlock them) 40 from the main game and 8 from the dlc so make sure to get it to complete everything.-steam trading cards.finally, i highly recommend this game for anyone that wants a good storytelling game worth the money ( i warn you you gonna cry :3) or make sure to grab it on sales (around 4.99$ - 7$) if its too much for you and dont forget the dlc because it adds some extra to the story and you will need it in S2.9/10

												Genre: AdventureThe game is based on the comic book series from Robert Kirkman and plays in the months following a zombie apocalypse. You play Lee Everett, a convicted murderer, who was on his way to prison, when the zombie apocalypse starts. In your adventure you meet a lot of different characters, including one known from the movie series. The most important of this characters is Clementine, a little orphaned girl, that you defend on your journey throughout the game.You have to make a lot of tough decisions in this game and the cool thing is that at the end you can see how the other gamers decided to play the game.From the storytelling part this is probably one of the best games in the last years.Positive:+ very good storytelling+ nice comicstyle graphics+ good voice actors+ breathtaking moments+ you make decisions, that influence the game in a way...Negative:- ... but in the end don't matter that much- episode format means that you have to wait some months to play the next chapter (outdated, as the game is completely available)In the end this is a very great game and a must play for every fan of adventures, zombie stories and i recommend everybody else just to try it out. It is worth it. Fun gameplay: ca. 14 hoursAchievements:Type: PlayingDifficulty: Very EasyTime needed: Little

content:
Posted: January 18
												This game flourished off the back of the success of the TV series, but it's every bit as enjoyable and well made in its own right. I'm one of the people who enjoyed the comic and the early series' of The Walking Dead more because they were more about the decisions and choices the characters make in different situations and scenarios and helped to show that human nature is an ugly beast, but very complex and interwoven, and never black and white. The video game facilitates this same process- showing the results of our different choices and decisions through the characters, and because you're playing one of those characters and vested in their outcome, everything that affects the world affects you on an emotional level.When it came out it was a somewhat unique gameplay mechanic for Point & Click Adventure games, and it's still limited- most choices don't actually affect the world or the linear story, yet it absolutely reaches you and makes the story and the things happening on screen more vivid and real.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												This is a preliminary review, since I'm only 1.5 hours into the game and haven't finished episode 1 yet.Let me start off by saying that I really don't care for anything involving zombies, with the exception of two things: Shaun of the Dead[www.imdb.com] and Left 4 Dead 2. And both of these things I like in spite of the zombies, and not because of them. Other than that, I just plain don't like zombies, and I'm well and thoroughly sick of them crossing over into every medium and genre imaginable. So it means something when I say that The Walking Dead overcomes my zombie hate easily and gets to be the third exception.As an adventure game, so far, TWD is no challenge. In fact, I've only stopped because I just hit the first "puzzle" I couldn't immediately solve, and that's probably just because I overlooked something. Gameplay is a mix between point and click, dialogue trees and the occasional quick time event. For those of you who hate QTEs (as well you might): the QTEs presented here are telegraphed well in advance and require little timing skill, so they actually enhance the immersion rather than breaking it from having to replay them over and over again, which is the major problem I have with QTEs.The appeal here is the story and not the gameplay, and the way it draws you in is masterfully done. Characters are introduced and you're given reasons to care for them (either positively or negatively) with a minimum of exposition and infodumping -- and that includes you, the protagonist. At the same time, it's clear that the story is driven by you and your actions, and you're not just clicking through to the next cutscene. Does every choice you make matter? Probably not. Is the game adept at making you think it does? Very.That's all I can say after 1.5 hours -- but if the rest is as good as what I've already seen, you should absolutely pick this up if you don't mind your games having more story than challenging gameplay. If you play games more for the elements of competition and challenge, though, this game's not going to satisfy you. Likewise, if you're into zombies for the gore or horror, this one probably won't excite you -- blood, severed limbs and strong language are not avoided, but they're not the focus. As interactive entertainment, though, this is great stuff.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
Telltale The Walking Dead: Season One ReviewWhen looking at the Steam awards and was told to choose a game that I wasn't expecting the tear up at, I naturally thought of this game. Telltale has tailored this game almost perfectly with twists, horror, sad moments and of course, decision making. I'm also writing this review because I am in love with this game and I would like to say why.The game allows you to make decisions that can potentially make all the difference later on. Having played through this game several times, I've noticed that even something you say early on in the game can make a difference to a coversation with a character later on. Your decisions will affect the opinions other characters have on you, which makes you feel involved. Personally, I prefer the game over the TV series and comics. I may well be a minority for it but the reason being is that I feel more involved in the story, which makes me care more for the characters. Making choices on who to save will make an impact on character relationships. I don't think Telltale got enough credit for their detail in characters such as Clementine, Lee, Carley, Doug, Kenny etc. I'm glad Telltale took their own route and made their own character's for their Telltale series. When I began to play this game a few years back, I had very little knowledge on what the game was about. I brought the game because I liked the concept of the decision making. If I could go back and play it again without any knowledge of the game, I would. I want this experience again.Keep that hair short.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												At this point, everyone should know what The Walking Dead is. The original comics. The legendary TV series at AMC. The dreadful Activision game and the point-and-click Walking Dead game. This game is very different from other video games as it relies more on storytelling, dialogue choices, quick decision making, and interactive mechanics like the Humongous Entertainment games when I was a toddler. I am one of the "late" gamer who just purchased this game during the 2014 Summer Sale. I already knew that the game did well, but I was not convinced that it is really that perfect. I was completely wrong. The first episode capture my attention and how dialogue choices can affect a player's emotion. You will feel happy when you pick the right choice. You will feel angry that your choice led to an utter disaster. You will feel sad when a character that you connect with fell apart. You will cry that you should had done something else. There is no doubt that The Walking Dead franchise is outstanding, but this game is, arguably, the best. I am very glad that I got this game and you should get this game too. Try this game out. It will convince you to continue playing until the last chapter in one playthrough.

												This game is brutal.Let me back up a little there. I saw the release of the game originally and expected it to be based on the first series of the TV show, not the graphic novels which I was unaware of, so I watched a few minutes of people streaming it then put it on my list of games to buy some time, no big hurry though. Then about a month ago I watched someone playing a while and remembered I wanted the game and lo and behold Steam put it on sale. I bought it.Sometimes I play a couple of hours of an FPS online and I get tired but it's a physical tiredness, The Walking Dead left me emotionally and mentally drained. The short time I watched people streaming it I laughed at their choices and told them how they were going wrong, armchair gaming, warrior style.  Now I have played it for myself I can see I was no better than the people I watched stream it, with my choices. This game is like interacting with a movie, the story is there but how you play it decides the outcomes of many situations and can decide the type of person you are, morality wise. When Kenny doesn't want to help me at the end of Chapter 4? I know I made some bad choices.I don't want to give any spoilers away, just play this game. Oh yeh, I said this game was brutal? If it doesn't punch you full on in the feels, you should check your pulse.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												The Walking Dead is an excellent interactive story with believable characters, beautiful artwork, voice acting and music, and a powerful emotional impact.There are some puzzles to solve and zombies to kill, but mostly the game involves deciding what to do or say to the other characters during time-limited interactions that are often filled with tension. These decisions make the story feel like it is your own, allowing you to shape Lee and his relationship with Clementine and the other characters, and I felt this resulted in it having more of an impact on me than if I had watched it on TV.The characters are well developed and felt real, many becoming people for whom I cared (and still think about) and it hurt to see them suffer during what were intense and sometimes devastating scenes. Oftentimes I found myself questioning my decisions, regardless of how justifiable they seemed. But while the story is pretty grim at times, there are touching moments as well, particularly during the interactions with Clementine, who is the heart and soul of the game.Expect to get around 2-4 hours per episode depending if you inspect everything and exhaust all dialogue options. I enjoyed The Walking Dead, and it is easily one of the best games I have played.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												This game is phenomenal and powerful. Very few games take into account the consequence of your actions as seriously as The Walking Dead does. It is quite a bleak experience, don't expect things to be sugarcoated here, the walker threat is real and its impact is felt throughout the whole game.The voice acting is top notch, which is a good thing, since this game is entirely plot driven. The characters are all great, you're meant to love some, hate some, and be somewhere in the middle of the road with others. Everyone has their own shades of gray, and the game really sends home the message that morality is secondary when you're purely dealing with survival. Every choice has its outcome, and its advantage along with its disavantage. It's worth replaying just to see how different it can be simply due to the most minor of decisions that you may have taken. It will make you remember each and every "yes" and "no" you have given, whether you like it or not, and you'll feel the full weight of the hard decisions you'll have to do due to circumstances that are, at times, unavoidable, so tread carefully.It is a point and click adventure, yes, but not one that gives you obscure clues like some games of this genre do. I personally do not have much experience with point and clicks, and while at first I thought I'd have trouble navigating through it, or even being stuck, I did just fine. It has its quick-time event moments when things get more hectic, and I found it fit the game perfectly.This game was again, a powerful, emotional, and unforgettable rollercoaster ride. It also brings out the dad in you and I'll just leave it at that. I need to play Season 2. The Walking Dead belongs in everyone's favorite game list, and I urge you to play this if you haven't yet. You won't come out unchanged.

content:
Posted: April 1
 This Is The Best Game I Have Ever Played.  This review doesn't contain any kind of information that is official or something like that. It only contains my opinion towards the game.  After playing this game over and over again, I noticed that there are some pros and cons about this game, and that's what I'm going to list in this review.  Pros  Comic Book Relief.   The game is based on the graphic novels of the same name by Robert Kirkman, Tony Moore, and Charlie Adlard, Robert Kirkman being the writer of the '' The Walking Dead '' Comic Books. Besides having the same graphics, It also has the same environment and some of the characters of his series, like Glenn that appeared on the first episode.  Storyline.   The Walking Dead ( Game ) has one of the best storiess I have ever saw. Because It gives you several options on how do you want the game to keep going, you can either support Kenny's plan ( Find a boat ), Lilly's plan ( Stay at the Motor Inn ), Clementine's plan ( Find her parents when they get to Savannah ) or create your own plan as the game progresses.  Lovable Characters.   There are characters that stay with you until the end. Because of that, you kind of create a strong bond between you and the characters. Besides, in this game, You'll also see that there are a lot of different characters, the reason is that the game wants you to identify yourself with one of the characters. Immersion   Now, this part is going to sound weird, but when I finished playing episode 1 & 2, I started to really like Lee, Clementine and Kenny, because of that, I kind of saw me as being Lee. Every choice I did after those episodes, I felt that I was the one doing them, not Lee. This game, at some weird reason makes you become the character, as if you really were experiencing what is happening in the game.  Emotions   Because of the Immersion and the Lovable Characters that I mentioned before, The game really punishes your feelings with no mercy. I'm not going to talk a lot about this subject because I don't want to ruin your experience, because this is the best pro about the game, I'm just going to say 1 thing, don't stop yourself from experiencing this game, let yourself feel the game, create a bond between the characters you really like, immerse yourself into the game, stop holding it back.  Choices   Be careful to the choices you make. Your choices influence the game a lot, and not only this season, the choices you make here also influences the season 2 and 3 of the '' The Walking Dead '' game.  So be aware. I'm going to give you a tip, If you aren't clear about what to do, just pause the game pressing space ( Only works for season 2 & 3 ) or by pressing the '' Esc '' button, And just take a moment to think about what you'll choose. It'll help you not to make precipitated choices. Cons  Sorry, but there are no cons about this game.  And Clem, Keep That Hair Short. ~ Lee

number of helpful: 13 of 19 people (68%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												First, some insight on why I'm reviewing a game that is already considered "Overwhelmingly Positive", and somewhat "old". Simply put, I fell in love with this game, and I couldn't stop playing it until I finished my first playthrough. A friend of mine even called me crazy, but he was the one crying when he first played it.I just hope you, or anyone else that plays the game, enjoy the game as much as I did (and will, even more).Without any further delay, I present to you my review of The Walking Dead, season 1.GameplayYou control a character called Lee, who is a convicted felon, that murdered his wife's lover (wouldn't we all?), and soon you find yourself between a sword and a wall, when a little girl called Clementine comes to your rescue.The story between Lee and Clementine will be the center of TWD: S1, as you meet survivors, some more evil than others, who force you to make decisions that will tailor the game. In the end, you'll not only be crying, but also thinking, "could I've done anything differently?", "could I've saved him/her?". The answer is something you'll have to figure out on your own.The graphics are comic bookish, which sets a nice mood to the game, since The Walking Dead is, in fact, a comic book series.The soundtrack doesn't fall behind, as it feels both smoothing and terrifying, depending on the situation you're facing.Pros Well written story that captivates the player, making the player feel he's part of the story; A wide array of choices to help the player choose where his loyalty lies; Touching story (a box of tissues should be included with the purchase of the game); Captivating graphics; Thrilling sountrack; Amazing voice acting; Realistic display of emotions.Cons The menu sound is incredibly annoying and repetitive, good thing you don't spend much time there anyway; You can, sometimes, tell when a new "clip" starts, as there's tiny distance from the characters previous position; Despite the story being incredibly well written, and the dialogues pretty smooth, there are some parts where if you go back to talk to someone, they just basically say to each other: "Hi", "Hi", "Bye", "Bye". Would be easier to just disable the option to talk to them, like it happens on other bits of the story; I saw Katjaa holding Duck, and then for the next minute or so of the story, everytime she appeared she looked like she was holding something, but Duck wasn't anywhere to be seen (a friend of mine told me this also happened to him on a console playthrough).VerdictI'd give it a 10/10 as I feel none of the cons/bugs are game breaking, while having a brilliant and touching story.Note: I wouldn't call myself a fan of the series. I like it, I'll watch it if it's on TV, but it's not something I look forward to watch every week. I feel it got boring after a while. However, the game is a lot better than the series. But that's just my take on it.PS. I also cried.

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
 Review: What is the ultimate goal of playing a video game?  What do we, as those interacting with the medium, hope to walk away with when we let go of the mouse and keyboard at the end of a gaming session?  The answer is simple, but it is often difficult to achieve in most games.  We play games to attempt to grasp a sense of accomplishment and connection with the story that we just dedicated precious time to accomplishing. Telltale Games’  The Walking Dead  provides the player with a definitive sense of satisfaction and concern for the story laid out over the course of five episodes.  An expertly crafted story guided by Telltale Games, but shaped by each individual player, guides the narrative of  The Walking Dead .  Set in a sudden and bleak zombie apocalypse, players assume the role of Lee Everett as he embarks on an emotionally powerful endeavor to survive in this new world whilst still holding on to what little sense of humanity can be grasped. The ageless formula and storytelling abilities of the “point and click” genre has achieved a near-perfection in every episode of  The Walking Dead .  At moments, controls can become finicky such as when navigating the main character, Lee Everett, around tight spaces, but this shortcoming in control is easily forgotten as the narrative itself of  The Walking Dead  slowly build up momentum and gathers the attention of all who have the chance to enjoy the game. Positives: The sense of personalization to the story and connection with the characters felt by the player in  The Walking Dead  is rarely found in gaming today.Episode 5: “No Time Left” instantly ranks amongst the most powerful moments in all of gaming.Even the smallest decisions made seem to come back and appear later on in the game as both minor references and also major repercussions.Musical score is equally as powerful as the writing of the story itself.The multitude of different endings possible leave for a very high replay value. Negatives: Controls can become tough to operate at times, but these moments were rare and few and lasted for only a brief few seconds.Pacing can become slow at some instances in the story, particular in Episode 3: "Long Road Ahead."  This by no means takes away form the overall experience of playing  The Walking Dead , but at points, momentary issues with pacing become prevalent. Summary: Telltale Games’  The Walking Dead  is a rarity in gaming today.  The connection developed and nurtured with the cast and their plight in the game begins instantly from the first moment and carries with the player through to the rolling of the final credits.  Support Telltale Games’ near masterpiece and download  The Walking Dead  today. Overall Score: 9.5 out of 10.0

number of helpful: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												I'm expecting this review to be short and so should you. This game has classic gameplay that can't be really talked about much. There aren't guns here or any machetes. This isn't Left 4 Dead.This grabs the comic books and says: "Alright, remember when zombie slaughter is cool in the TV Show and fanboys don't shut about how awesome it is to chop heads off and look at Daryl's marvelously awesome hair of badassness? Well ♥♥♥♥ all that! We want to tell a story, like a true zombie game should tell, about the desperation of the survivors in a world lost to a virus that came out of nowhere!"And it succeeded at that. More so than the TV show. I now want more Telltale TWD Games. Not the TV Show.The TV Show kinda sold it's soul. You start 1st and 2nd season with what? Oh right, zombies, desperation and survival."- Guys, this♥♥♥♥♥♥s giving more money than Brazil gave to the stadium contructions for the World Cup 2014! We gotta do more seasons!""- Sir?!""- Yes, Zach?""- Uhh, I think zombies are becoming repetitive by now and the fans would be sick of zombies in a 3rd and 4th season...""- Well, ain't this a zombie TV Show?""- Ehhh...Good point, Sir! But I think we should add variety! How about add a generic villain and make this another TV Show about turf wars?""- Uhmm... Interesting, Zach, and what about the zombies?""- ♥♥♥♥'em, Sir! We'll slap some Microsoft Paint background in there and we focus on the gun on gun action between humans! No one will expect that! It's like a plot twist!""- Heh...good idea!" (After 5 minutes) - "Yo! I just wrote the script for the next 2 seasons, print this♥♥♥♥♥♥and give it to the actors!"*A lot of $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$ later...*It became so boring and no longer unique. They are just rolling this into a big snow ball that will never end! It was so cool before, about true survival. Not anymore. Now it's like Dragon Ball of some♥♥♥♥♥♥ About looking badass n' stuff...Ugh anyways. I'm happy to report the game is the true return to the Walking Dead. This game is 90% story focused with conversations and decision making. Like an RPG, where you Role-Play. Gameplay's far from an RPG though. It's like a traditional point n' click adventure. Mixing items and solving some issues/obstacles along the way. Very simple and it's even simpler in the game. The puzzles are very easy and dont require much Einstein thinking.The star is the characters. You play as Lee Everett, a convicted felon for murder who has a car crash on his way to jail. He then heads to a home to get assistance. He then meets a lovely little girl alone at home. Clementine's her name.A huge journey then starts! With you protecting Clementine from anything that resembles a threat. A journey about emotions and hard decisions for you to make. It exhibits shock to the point of the player suffering true disgust and his/her stomach turned upside-down (Oh man... chapter 2. Holy...)Anyways I'll cut down to the chase. This is the best storyline in a video game ever! I've been gaming for over 12 ♥♥♥♥ing years! This game in the end accumulated everything you build up through your 10-12 single player campaign to deliver the most hardcore and blood-pressure increasing ending I've had the pleasure of witnessing. Everything ended with some suspense and at the same time, a satisfying sense of conclusion. And then the credits rolled...I couldn't see them well to be honest...":O, why?"Because my eyes were covered in tears... yeah... I cried like a ♥♥♥♥♥ in the end and I am 100% proud of that. It proves games can tell emotional stories no other entertainment type can. You can't get this related to a character unless you play as them in a video game! Also proves I'm human! So... it killed 2 birds in one stone...That was the ultimate proof of success of it's storytelling. And I will never forget this game nor stop recommending this as much as I humanly can.There isn't much to talk about tbh. Voice acting is superb. Plot Twists and bat♥♥♥♥♥♥awesome. The ending is... no words can be said because no word exists to describe it well enough...Graphics are looking for the comic book look. And it succeeds. It tried to get the look right (which it got) and not to get Crysis 3 PC-Melting 1080p 3D Looking grass!Problems... ehhh... some bugs. I got stuttering issues on the first chapter. A huge bug/glitch on the second chapter. Game-breaking I'd say. But I managed to get it fixed, just restart a checkpoint or wait for the bug "to run away".Also, some choices seem like they matter. LOLNOPE. Some give you the (well done) illusion of choice, when if fact: you don't have it. You really don't. I would say it's quite disappointing.But as a (semi) linear story. It's perfect, it really is... Oh look, this review is huge again! I really can't control myself...Anyways, my final score is an 8/10 and I will go against common knowledge that score is what mattersin a review. Because it doesn't. it only appeals to those math/score nerds (like me). The Walking Dead is my personal Game of The year of 2012, even though other candidates have much higher scores of 9's and 9.5's.So go wild! Grab the money you saved for your rent or your girlfriend's engagement ring and get this right now!

												This game is just simply amazing and beautiful. It's not just another zombie game where you see how long you can survive by killing thousands of zombies. It tells a story and that's a nice change of pace. It follows closer to the comic than the TV show and that's what I love about it. In my opinion the game is FAR better than the TV show. I guess the hype is all it's lived up to be. Graphics: 10/10Story: 10/10I recommend this to anyone who loves The Walking Dead.

number of helpful: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
Immersive, gripping, emotionalWell, much has already been written about the video game "The Walking Dead" (season one). As a huge fan of the tv-series, I wondered how the game would turn out to be. Would it be another gore- and slaughter-festival, and how would they manage to incorporate the grim feeling of the series into a game?The answer to this is simple: TellTaleGames came out with a trump card, by casting this game as an interactive story. It's not about gore, not about fast and furious action, not about mashing buttons and quick reflexes (although there a some mild action scenes here and there). No, the whole idea is: you are the protagonist in a world where Walkers have taken over, and you have to make choices in order to survive. Choices: that's where this game is all about. Some trivial ones, some which have to be made fast (the time you have to decide is often limited), and some totally impossible and even heart-breakingly difficult. And what's more: it's often impossible to tell beforehand how the choice you make will influence the game and the story.Seldom have I felt so emotionally involved into a game. After a couple of chapters and especially by the second episode (there are six of them, all good for a couple of hours of gameplay), I was completely into this game, feeling connected to the main character and to the little girls he has vowed to protect. Form that moment on, this was no longer a floating gaming experience, no, it was more lke reading a gripping book, but with an extra: the ability of steering the story to a limited way. Awesome!Gameplay: 28/30 (simply superb storytelling)Graphics: 16/20 (comic novel and shell-shaded, very well done)Sound: 8/10Replayability: 16/20 (it's tempting to play a second time and make different decisions)Stability/technical: 17/20 (there are some short hiccups now and then when the screens change)Overall: 85/100

The game shines through your emotional investment.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												The recent TellTale games have quickly become my favourite games and it began with this incredible game. The Walking Dead has you play as a Lee Everret, a man on his way to prison on the day the outbreak began who takes on a small girl, Clementine, who you vow to protect as you journey through the big bad world looking for more survivors. I've never been a fan of point and click games but I am a fan of rich singleplayer stories and that is what this game delivers+Gorgeous cell-shaded art style+A compelling story +Unrivalled story telling+Amazing voice acting+Five episodes each around two hours long+The choices you make have consequences on the rest of the game, sometimes minute, sometimes massive+Very interesting characters who have rich backstories+At the end of each episode you can compare your choices with others who have played the game+Less focus on zombies, more focus on the people who you meet meaning you quickly become attached +The most heart-wrenching ending to a game I have ever encountered+/-Most of the gameplay comes from looking around or quick time events but if you're here for gameplay you're in the wrong placeVerdict:10Easily one of my all-time favourite games. It's probably not for everyone but I for one adore it. The perfect game for those who love a good story and/or The Walking Dead universe.El K.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
IntroThis story driven game was developed and published by Telltales. The game was released in a series of episodes that came out months apart from each other.The episodes themselves were decently long going up to 1 (or 1 1/2) hours.  I am glad they learned from their experiences from their previous title Jurassic Park. It could have easily went bad if they didn't learn how to better develop fleshed out survival scenarios with characters who feel like they have depth and made reliable and realistic choices that you could relate to. Game or Interactive Movie?The only thing to keep in mind is that the freedom of movement compared to other games is obviously far less since its a adventure game. You cannot go back and revisit areas without reloading the chapters (unless its segments within that chapter). That’s because from chapter to chapter you're in a completely different location. This works well with constantly changing the environment. Character DrivenWalking dead doesn’t shine for having a great plot because lets be honest there is nothing really original with the overall idea of a zombie apocalypse. The characters and the angle they take on the story is what makes this extremely interesting. The depth is not on the zombies itself but on the instincts of survival. When people are backed into a corner sometimes the best and worst of people shine. Choice is Character DrivenChoice in this game didn’t feel like it impacts a lot like other games, however it does impact your relationships with the other characters. This to me is really nice because it doesn’t feel like i could bargain with NPC’s like, saying something nice 5 times to neutralize the time i robbed their piggy bank. Death is Character DrivenDon’t get used to anyone around you because they are not going to stay around for long. Typically people in this game die sooner or later depending on the choices you make. Some deaths are even unavoidable, but I will not spoil what ones. I will say that some of them got to me weather it was startling from the explosive instance of death or the slow horrible but inevitable death lingering around them. EndingWithout spoiling anything, this ending really concludes well with the game. It gives you satisfaction of beating the story, while also making you want to have more.\

												Pros:+ new/different storyline from amc show+ two familiar characters from show for fans+ good voice acting+ story is never boring+ not too many jump scares (I only remember maybe three times)+ good save system before places you can die (minimal story repeat)+ compares your choices to other gamers' at the ends of episodesCons:- no native ps4 controller support (there is xbox)- limited response time for dialogue/fights (pro for realism?)- must buy DLC to get all achievementsOverall very entertaining game, even after coming from Life Is Strange. number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
												An amazing and captivating game which allows the player to immerse themselves within a world of choice during the course of a zombie apocalypse. You are a university teacher responsible for the death of your wife's lover and being sent to prison.The story is split into 5 episodes, roughly 2 hours each, in which you meet other survivors and develop opinions on their character. You can also make more difficult choices in the spare of the moment, creating or breaking bonds between certain characters. The beauty of this game is that every choice, every dialogue can affect certain opinions of you and alter the story somewhat importantly.The game offers a solid 10+ hours of gameplay, not including the DLC "The Walking Dead: 400 Days" (which is also an amazing and fairly cheap add-on) and the range of choices which alter the game, gives it an element of replayability.Overall, the game was simple and fun, with it largely focusing on the element of choice which allows individual players to tailor a personal experience. The graphics were unique and had the usual Telltale Games look about it. An amazing game I'd recommend to all Walking Dead and non-Walking dead fans alike.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 21, 2012
												Games that are tailored to the decisions you make are pretty few and far between these days, and eventually that itch is going to need some serious scratching.  Well, scratch away, people, because Telltale Games has you covered with this episodic title.  Basically, in a nutshell, the game is a dialogue heavy, decision based platform with a few quick-time event sequences in them.  While it's compared to Heavy Rain, The Walking Dead has strengths over Heavy Rain, and vice versa.  The decisions in The Walking Dead feel like they have a much greater impact on the story than Heavy Rain, however, the QTE sequences in Heavy Rain are extremely intense and failing them has great consequences.  In The Walking Dead, QTE failure just makes you restart it, so literally nothing is at stake during them and they feel like padding.  In the end, The Walking Dead is a very absorbing title for those who enjoy games with decision making over action, and is well worth the price.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2013
												Walking Dead is rather like watching five episodes of a new version of the show, complete with credits and “previously” montages, which all seems a bit odd for a video game . Based on the comic rather than the TV show, the game-play is a little lacking. Instead the game focuses on the story and the numerous difficult decisions and their often dire consequences. Oh, and now and then you have to hit a few keys in typical QTE style. It seems almost as if the game designers didn’t like the TV show and wanted to bring us the original story, but couldn’t afford live actors. Despite this, it has to be said that the story is much, much better than the TV show. For a start there is a black guy as the star, rather than the all American, gun toting plonker sheriff that we have in the TV show. And although there sure is stereotypoing, it's far less than the TV show - women can not only shoot in the game, but they often steal the show in the action sequences. That’s a totally different picture to the TV show, which often painted them as only fit to do the cooking and washing up.So all in all the game comes recommended, but don’t expect great game-play, instead settle in to a great story and atmosphere.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												The Walking Dead was one of the first games I was introduced to on Steam. I hadn’t ever played a game quite like this one. Before playing The Walking Dead, in my eyes games were limited to Pac-Man, platformers like Mario, multiplayer racing games, Zoo Tycoon, etc. I never really experienced a “choose your own adventure” game before, and prior to playing this game.. I wasn’t really all that interested in trying one either.Although I went into this game kicking and screaming, an episode or two in, I was hooked. I was not a huge fan of the blood and gore, but that aside, the story was very inviting. I truly felt as if I was making all of the major decisions in the game, therefore influencing how my character, as well as all those around me would turn out in the end. I grew attached to some characters (Ben) that took me on an emotional journey at times, which was interesting to me, because I never knew that games could get you to feel such emotional ties to a fictional character.Like I mentioned earlier, this game lets YOU decide how you want to play the game. You could play as the hero, or the villain. You can choose to leave people behind, and you can choose to save peoples lives. The most interesting part of the game is seeing how your choices you make earlier in the game can influence how your games pans out 2 or 3 episodes down the line.You start out the game as a man named Lee. You do not know much about Lee, but you soon start to see his backstory unfold. He may have a criminal background, but you can choose whom, if anyone, you want to share this information with as you begin to make bonds and partnerships with people. You later run into a little girl named Clementine. You learn she is currently on her own when something terrible happened to her babysitter when her parents went out on a trip. You and Clementine team up and try to escape the monsters that seem to be taking over the area. She reminds you time and time again that the main goal is to find and reunite her with her family, until then, you are her guardian. The things you two will encounter and defeat together give you two an almost inseparable bond. You two start to learn things about each other not many people may know, which will help you in the end when you have to make some major life altering choices. You will meet a number of other survivors, victims, and criminals along your journey together. You will have to make decisions on who you trust and don’t trust, and hope that the people you do bring along for the ride will have your back when it counts.Just remember that ALL of the choices you make, whether they are big or small will have some sort of repercussion. Some decisions you will have to make in a split second, and others you will have a little more time to think about.. but all your decisions are very important. Even though you may not always be able to save everyone from death and destruction, you have to remember your main goal is to keep Clementine safe. This is another layer to the game that makes all of your choices in the long run an emotional journey. Just when you think that you feel you’ve gotten away with something, remember you will have her watching you from the sidelines, learning to act just as you do.I hope you do give this game a fair try. There is a reason it has been so successful, the writers do know what they are doing. The artwork is different which makes gameplay enjoyable. Even though you are placed in a time period that may be depressing and hopeless, the graphics somehow make you almost feel a glimpse of hope to reach for. Being an apocalyptic type game, there is a fair share of blood and guts, but most times it is safe to turn your head and look away for a slit second. Embrace this different form of gameplay and open your eyes to the new experiences and emotions that will rapidly unfold when you play this game.

I was not a huge fan of the blood and gore, but that aside, the story was very inviting. I truly felt as if I was making all of the major decisions in the game, therefore influencing how my character, as well as all those around me would turn out in the end. I grew attached to some characters (Ben) that took me on an emotional journey at times, which was interesting to me, because I never knew that games could get you to feel such emotional ties to a fictional character.Like I mentioned earlier, this game lets YOU decide how you want to play the game. You could play as the hero, or the villain. You can choose to leave people behind, and you can choose to save peoples lives. The most interesting part of the game is seeing how your choices you make earlier in the game can influence how your games pans out 2 or 3 episodes down the line.You start out the game as a man named Lee. You do not know much about Lee, but you soon start to see his backstory unfold. He may have a criminal background, but you can choose whom, if anyone, you want to share this information with as you begin to make bonds and partnerships with people. You later run into a little girl named Clementine. You learn she is currently on her own when something terrible happened to her babysitter when her parents went out on a trip. You and Clementine team up and try to escape the monsters that seem to be taking over the area. She reminds you time and time again that the main goal is to find and reunite her with her family, until then, you are her guardian. The things you two will encounter and defeat together give you two an almost inseparable bond. You two start to learn things about each other not many people may know, which will help you in the end when you have to make some major life altering choices. You will meet a number of other survivors, victims, and criminals along your journey together. You will have to make decisions on who you trust and don’t trust, and hope that the people you do bring along for the ride will have your back when it counts.Just remember that ALL of the choices you make, whether they are big or small will have some sort of repercussion. Some decisions you will have to make in a split second, and others you will have a little more time to think about.. but all your decisions are very important. Even though you may not always be able to save everyone from death and destruction, you have to remember your main goal is to keep Clementine safe. This is another layer to the game that makes all of your choices in the long run an emotional journey. Just when you think that you feel you’ve gotten away with something, remember you will have her watching you from the sidelines, learning to act just as you do.I hope you do give this game a fair try. There is a reason it has been so successful, the writers do know what they are doing. The artwork is different which makes gameplay enjoyable. Even though you are placed in a time period that may be depressing and hopeless, the graphics somehow make you almost feel a glimpse of hope to reach for. Being an apocalyptic type game, there is a fair share of blood and guts, but most times it is safe to turn your head and look away for a slit second. Embrace this different form of gameplay and open your eyes to the new experiences and emotions that will rapidly unfold when you play this game.

												There is nothing to say about this game, which has not already been said. Having that said, I am going to say this. I doubted the game upon start. I rejected the choice of graphic style. I thought the music was lacking, I felt the characters were shallow. When I was mid-way through, I was hooked, I felt that someone had touched my heart, I was shocked about some of the scenes, I had built up new friendships, I had glanced at love and I were curious about the future.When I finished the game, I sat empty, yet my mind was filled with new wonderful things. I cried, not only from loneliness, but from happiness and fulfillment. I was ready to let it go, yet something inside of me wished for more.If I would have missed out on this game, I would not have been as complete as I am today. Though just a game with a lot of options, it changes you. It’s hard to walk away from this game untouched, or to wonder if it were something you could have changed. Was there something you could have done differently?

number of helpful: 11 of 17 people (65%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												The Walking Dead is an adventure game by Telltale Games Studios best known for developing episodic games, such as Sam & Max, Wallace & Gromit, Tales of Monkey Island, Back to the Future, and Jurassic Park. The game is based on the award-winning comic book series created by Robert Kirkman, entitled The Walking Dead.The game is split into episodes that make up seasons, just like a TV show. The main protagonist of the first season of The Walking Dead is Lee Everett. The story begins at the outbreak of zombie apocalypse, at the time when Rick Grimes (the protagonist of the comic) is in coma. When the infection begins its bloody harvest, Lee is sitting handcuffed at the backseat of a police car. He was arrested for murdering a man who slept with his wife. The developers decided to present adventures of an entirely new group of people, while the major inspiration in the creation process was Robert Kirkman’s work, which is regarded by the developers as the canonical version of the story. Players can visit places and meet characters well-known from the comic books and learn additional information about them. The first season of the game is divided into five episodes. Completing each takes on average about two hours.The gameplay mainly consists of exploration, conducting conversations, collecting items, and solving puzzles. From time to time there are also simple action sequences, but it is worth noting that QTE (quick time events) do not play such an important role in this game, as they did in the previous production from Telltale Games - Jurassic Park. In contrast to a typical zombie game, The Walking Dead is not about exterminating hordes of undead. The developers decided on a slower-paced gameplay, and players need to keep quiet, especially in places where the walking dead like to roam.The Walking Dead is the first game from Telltale, in which decisions made by the players influence the experience. What you do in the first episode has consequences later in the story. It is worth noting that players have a limited time to make a decision and do not have a chance to carefully reflect on possible repercussions. When it comes to puzzles that you encounter in the game, they do not resemble “adventure game-like problems”, but reflect the reality of a zombie apocalypse. The creators also saw to it that the environment was interactive, so to provided players with more freedom when solving puzzles.The title has attractive, cartoon-like graphics, slightly resembling the comic books by Robert Kirkman. The game does not feature multiplayer mode and is distributed only via digital means.9.4/10

content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												Just an amazing and extremely sad story.If you are not playing this game because you don't like the walking dead tv series well I don't like it either! Yes I watched all the seasons and I think the whole story is crap, how the characters behave, they all act like idiots or teenagers with a lot of hormones on them, everything that happens is stupid and you can't believe it I cannot feel attach or care with any of the characters because they are idiots and do stupid things, they are always putting themselves on risky situations for nothing. Here in the game on the other hand it's just as real as it gets (well sometimes you will find silly things but they are very scarce throughout the game), your main protagonist acts like a real human ADULT guy and the choices you made are really hard ones and they do carry consequences in both long and short term. You will end up caring for the characters.You will hate some characters and love others, but all of them behave like real people!The voice acting is superb!This game is a must game, BUY IT you won't regret it.The bad: Well the game is very poor optimized, don't know if it's the engine or what but it will hang between scenes for a few seconds, it's really annoying.The save system is not the best either, it will save from time to time (always on the same parts) so lets say you made a choice but you dont like it and want to load and try it again...well bad luck for you, sometimes you will have to play 30min...You can't skip the dialogs. (in a game like this with a lot of choices it's a must!)The DLC is very short!Last and I don't know if this is a bad thing (it was for me) the dialog options sometimes goes too fast, there are times when you don't have time to read what's on the screen but you need to take an action or the game will do it for you, lets say you need to read 4 lines in 3 seconds. (most of the time the games picks to not say anything at all on those cases) Happened to me 1 time on the entire game but It felt like the game was forcing me to take an answer and maybe with more time to think about it I would picked other and not that one.

ENGLISH and Italian Review Recensione Inglese ed ITALIANA English:Seriously, just buy it. It's wonderful, i can tell without a doubt that it's one of the best games i ever played in my entire life. It's an interactive story in a zombie-apocalypse universe, where all your choices will influence the events and the final. Yup, it's that kind of story.  And not a simple story, but a well written story, with well done characters and above all, an EMOTIONAL story. Because, let's face it, this game not only has an intuitive and enjoyable gameplay and a great story, but it even offers a series of emotions that leave its mark, if you LIVE fully the game. And they remain with you. It's simply perfect. 10/10, and i would forget it just to play it again. (Sorry for my bad english.)Italiano:Seriamente, compralo e basta. E' stupendo, posso dire a mani basse che sia uno dei migliori giochi a cui abbia mai giocato in tutta la mia esistenza. Parliamo di una storia interattiva in un universo di apocalisse zombie, dove ogni scelta che fai, influenzerà gli eventi che seguono e sul finale. Esatto, è quel tipo di storia! E non una storia qualsiasi, ma una storia ben curata, dai personaggi ben caratterizzati e soprattutto una storia EMOTIVA. Perché diciamocelo, questo gioco non solo ha un gameplay intuitivo e piacevole ed una storia fantastica, ma offre anche tutta una serie di emozioni che lasciano il segno, se vivi il gioco appieno, ti rimangono dentro. E' semplicemente perfetto, 10/10 e lo dimenticherei volentieri, solo per giocarlo e riscoprirlo ancora.

content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												Decent controls with an effective user interface, The Walking Dead only lacks a fullscreen borderless-windowed mode in the video settings and built in accomodations for when playing the game offline, because without an internet connection your achievements will not be tracked and you may experience long pauses between segments.That being said, what this recommendation really comes down to is simply the story. As far as video game plots go, I'd say this is one of the best. And coming from someone who probably doesn't have much taste at all for the average story-driven game, that's saying quite a lot. Personally I've found most video games to lack good story development. Even when they are highly praised for it, like BioShock Infinite for example, to me they usually become rather boring after the first couple chapters of gameplay. The Walking Dead is the greatest exception to that, without a doubt it has found the perfect mixture of fast paced story-telling, interactive gameplay that will affect the plot, and characters that will not only strike an emotional response, but will have you growing more and more attached to them as they develop indepth throughout every episode.I'm confident this game can be recommended to almost anybody. After you've played through the first episode the story will keep you coming back for more. And with the amount of impact your gameplay decisions have on the plot, anyone who picks it up will become very attatched to this game and its characters.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												After being recommended by a lot of people to play this game, I finally did, and I must say it would have to be one of greatest and moving zombie apocalypse games, and playing it was actually an amazing decision. And after that, now I am recommending it myself.  So this game is based on The Walking Dead comic books, and something that I really like about it too is how the graphics of the game follows the theme of comic art, which I found to be great. You can see even if the characters aren’t talking, the expressions on their face show their emotions. I really thought that was great. The sound effects are amazing, and always keep you focused on the game and make it that little bit more realistic (and can make you jump as well even if you’re not paying full attention).The game gets you from the moment you start it. You go on a journey through tragedy, fear, pressure, suspense, sadness… the list goes on. If you play this game and don’t get emotionally attached or feel any sort of these emotions I’d be surprised. 	Speaking of surprises the game is full of them, it’s unexpected, and some things that happen in the game will leave you shocked. The gameplay is simple, and the game itself is kind of like a movie, and when prompted you follow the instructions given. I like how the story is based on the decisions you make yourself, which is just another reason why I loved this game.There isn’t much else to say, all I’d suggest now is grabbing a copy of this game and a box of tissues and enjoy yourself!✮✮✮✮✮

content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												I've seen my share of zombie movies and played my share of zombie games without ever becoming particularly impressed by any. Honestly I find most of them outright stupid, and with the zombie hype that has been going on the last few years the genre as a whole mostly leaves a foul taste in my mouth. But somehow I got talked into watching this show called "The Walking Dead" and it totally blew me over. Well written, great character building and feelings flying all over the board. I found it amazing that something related to zombies could be THAT good.Then I learned about that this series, or rather the universe of that series, was going to be carried over to an episodic adventure type game by no other than Telltale Games. A company that has helped keeping the adventure genre of gaming alive when it felt almost extinct. As a BIG adventure game fan I have happily supported this company by getting mostly everything they have put out, and that was also mainly the reason I got this series as well.I honestly had very little expectation of how this game series would be as I failed to see how it even would work to transfer the great writing and suspense that I experienced in the TV-series to an adventure type game. Even though I read good reviews of it I kept putting off playing it. I was absolutely certain that it was going to leave me disappointed.Well, finally I got around to play it, and now I kick myself fo not playing it sooner. I can not believe how good this game is. I don't think I can remember better storywriting in any game I've played before. You really get to know the characters you meet and you get feelings and opinions about them. You're forced to make tough decisions in critical moments and you can never be sure if you did the right thing. Well, there is not really any clear right or wrong. There is mostly various shades of grey. Not only that, but your decisions affect the ones around you, and they will remember what you did or didn't do, and the game itself shapes itself around all this and creates different routes and takes on what you experience while playing through it.All characters are masterfully voiced by a selection of excellent voice actors that helps making the experience close to magical. You'll find yourself laughing, crying, yelling at the screen and acting in panic. And you'll probably feel that you're in the middle of it all.Now, it has to be said that this game is probably not for everybody. I can see, and even understand that people might find the gameplay itself to be a bit dull or repetetive and probably feel there is little gameplay at all. If you hate QTE's then you might want to shy away if you do not appreciate a good story. Also, even though I quite like the artstyle I see some people being thrown off a bit by the comic like cel shading, and I believe the game would be even better with a bit more realistic touch. It certainly looks good enough in its own way and should in any way be avoided with that as a reason.I consider this game to be one of those games you absolutely should not allow yourself to miss out on. It is a game for the history books and you would want to tell your grandchildren that you were there to play it.I rate this game 10/10Recommended for everybody who appreciate video games, and their mothers too.Happy GamingTJ

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25, 2014
												Wonderful game in my opinion. There are some flaws such as the illusion of choice at some places (you can't change the main script event), not very much of a gameplay itself (mostly QTE and choosing between 3 variants of an answer), but these flaws don't spoil the whole impression you get when you play the game.I am not a fan of TV show Walking dead (watched a few episodes, didn't like them) and I haven't read the novel, so I didn't know what to expect from the game. But when I started it, I fell in love. Telltale games can really tell the tale, the story is the main core of the game.The characters are alive, they have personalities. My favourite is of course Clementine. She's just a child who becomes grown up having seen bad things happen throughout the whole story. There are some genuinely funny moments, but the most memorable are the tragic ones. Honestly, I almost cried during one of them.The game uses cell-shading style, and I think it really suits here. The game is based on graphic novel, so it looks like one.All in all, it's one of the best stories I have ever played. 10 out of 10.P.S. What concerns DLC 400 days. It's a good addition to the first season, as you meet a few familiar faces. And I know that it is a bridge between 1st and 2nd seasons, but as a standalone game it isn't worth it. For the fans only.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												Very good game I highly recommend this game, without a doubt! However... the graphics for a 2012 game are pretty poor but if you are the kind of person that likes story driven games, you'll love The Walking Dead. Gameplay can get repetitive, so I would suggest playing every episode day by day, if you play all 5 episodes in one day I think it would be pretty boring. So yes, I recommend this game and I would give it a 9.5/10 there is no questioning why this game won game of the year 2012 so many times - Side note buy this before "The Walking Dead: A New Frontier" or "The Walking Dead: Season 2". But yeah, the story provides a unique experience, and I would pay full price for this game, without a doubt!

content:
Posted: January 7, 2013
												If you're a fan of zombie shooting or can't stand to be in a more psychological story game, don't buy that. The Walking Dead is a beautiful, albeit tragic, tale of people surviving a walker apocalypse: the choices you're making, while not impacting the ending, have an effect on your relationships with the others and also for other episodes: you save someone in Episode 1 instead of the other, it's that character that will appear the rest of the season 1. Buy it. Seriously.In more words, you're incarning Lee Everett, a convict that kill the man sleeping with his wife. He accepted his guilt as the honest man he is and during his journey to the jail, the police car has an accident with a zombie. Lee, surviving this, meets Clementine, a little girl, all alone in her house as her parents are in Savannah and her sitter is kinda... well... a walker now. Together, they'll journey through Georgia, meeting Kenny and his family, Lilly and Larry, her father, Carley, Doug and many others. Some of them will be just passing by, the others will be a group. Lee has only Clementine in mind. And during the five episodes, it will be like that.The first episode is introducting Lee, Clementine, Kenny, his family and the rest of the people that will be your group during the game (albeit some of them will disappear or appear later). You have also some characters from the comic/TV series as Hershel Greene or Glenn.The second episode is showing the life at the motel, where the group established his shelter. Some local people invite them to their farm, though Lee or Kenny are suspicious of the place. Drama will follow.The third episode is mainly set on the road, as the shelter has been attacked by bandits: between a RV and the train, Lee and Clementine will lose friends and meet new ones though a new enemy is finally revealed.The fourth episode is set in Savannah, where the group arrived and search for a boat, though they meet another group and agree to help each other. Some decisions are also made and Lee seals his fate.The fifth episode concludes the game: Lee searches for Clementine that, naive as she is, followed a stranger promising that her parents were alive and waiting for her, despite his state....The story is really the strong point of the game. While it's true that you're mainly pointing to stuff to have information and discussing, some choices have to be made: save that person or the other? Trust someone or not? Some quick time events are also present, some of them are kinda rigged because you can't win them but you don't necessarily die. Also, your decisions are influencing your relationships with others.The graphics are also quite good. Colorful yet tragic. Anyway, you're not bored because you're moving around too. Besides, the voice acting is also well-done.Nah, I loved the game, with all the tragic fates, some unexpected, some you're happy to see and others you wish they never happened. It's a nice entry into the Walking Dead universe, much more respectful than the TV series: they killed Andrea when she is a badass in the comic and still alive...
