content:
Posted: November 13, 2016
												Let me be clear. This game is a cinematic point and click adventure game. But not as in the sense of old school Lucas Arts Point & click games ála Days of the Tentacle. Let's say this games forte is in the storytelling and creating illusions of you making valuable choices and putting them right in your own hands. The preset is good and episode one sucks you right into the world, directly from the getgo you care and want to be involved in the main characters adventure and see what the story is about and how it all plays out. The best part of this game, outside of the story is the pacing. Very rarely do you get frustrated by getting stuck somewhere in the game becuase you are unsure of what to do next, which usually is the case in such games. It only happened to me once in this game where I had to go and youtube it and to see how to get to further ahead in the story (The keys in pharmacy shop). That's what's so great about this game and maybe also not so great. Since the choices are so clear and given, it leaves you, the player, with little to no alternatives to do what YOU want. Say that perhaps in an heated arguement I would like to get out of there, or perhaps in an outbreak I want to stand and shoot more zombies and play hero, or I would like to escape with everyones valuables in the middle of the night and leave them stranded and so on. Of course these actions would not jell well with the main storyline, which I do get, but in a game like this, if there is anything I could wish for, it would enabling more choices for the player to make and truly effect the goodness or badness or the meh-ness of the character and the fates of those whom the character encounters. However, wIth the given choices also comes the responsibilities with the chosen actions, and this is why I think the pacing of the story is so good. With fever options a clearer story emerges and you are hooked in it all the way from the beginning until the end, at around 2,5-3 hours of gameplay, with some replay value if you care, I personally don't.The Walking Dead is simply a fresh take on the Point and click genre and makes me want to play some more. But for 10$-20$ I am not so sure if I can say it's worth all your money. But if you can get it on a sale somewhere, around 3-4 dollars/Euros, it absolutley is worth both your time and your money. The game will get you invested and interested, which is all that really matters in the end.I can't wait to get started with episode two.

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												After being recommended by a lot of people to play this game, I finally did, and I must say it would have to be one of greatest and moving zombie apocalypse games, and playing it was actually an amazing decision. And after that, now I am recommending it myself.  So this game is based on The Walking Dead comic books, and something that I really like about it too is how the graphics of the game follows the theme of comic art, which I found to be great. You can see even if the characters aren’t talking, the expressions on their face show their emotions. I really thought that was great. The sound effects are amazing, and always keep you focused on the game and make it that little bit more realistic (and can make you jump as well even if you’re not paying full attention).The game gets you from the moment you start it. You go on a journey through tragedy, fear, pressure, suspense, sadness… the list goes on. If you play this game and don’t get emotionally attached or feel any sort of these emotions I’d be surprised. 	Speaking of surprises the game is full of them, it’s unexpected, and some things that happen in the game will leave you shocked. The gameplay is simple, and the game itself is kind of like a movie, and when prompted you follow the instructions given. I like how the story is based on the decisions you make yourself, which is just another reason why I loved this game.There isn’t much else to say, all I’d suggest now is grabbing a copy of this game and a box of tissues and enjoy yourself!✮✮✮✮✮

content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												Decent controls with an effective user interface, The Walking Dead only lacks a fullscreen borderless-windowed mode in the video settings and built in accomodations for when playing the game offline, because without an internet connection your achievements will not be tracked and you may experience long pauses between segments.That being said, what this recommendation really comes down to is simply the story. As far as video game plots go, I'd say this is one of the best. And coming from someone who probably doesn't have much taste at all for the average story-driven game, that's saying quite a lot. Personally I've found most video games to lack good story development. Even when they are highly praised for it, like BioShock Infinite for example, to me they usually become rather boring after the first couple chapters of gameplay. The Walking Dead is the greatest exception to that, without a doubt it has found the perfect mixture of fast paced story-telling, interactive gameplay that will affect the plot, and characters that will not only strike an emotional response, but will have you growing more and more attached to them as they develop indepth throughout every episode.I'm confident this game can be recommended to almost anybody. After you've played through the first episode the story will keep you coming back for more. And with the amount of impact your gameplay decisions have on the plot, anyone who picks it up will become very attatched to this game and its characters.

ENGLISH and Italian Review Recensione Inglese ed ITALIANA English:Seriously, just buy it. It's wonderful, i can tell without a doubt that it's one of the best games i ever played in my entire life. It's an interactive story in a zombie-apocalypse universe, where all your choices will influence the events and the final. Yup, it's that kind of story.  And not a simple story, but a well written story, with well done characters and above all, an EMOTIONAL story. Because, let's face it, this game not only has an intuitive and enjoyable gameplay and a great story, but it even offers a series of emotions that leave its mark, if you LIVE fully the game. And they remain with you. It's simply perfect. 10/10, and i would forget it just to play it again. (Sorry for my bad english.)Italiano:Seriamente, compralo e basta. E' stupendo, posso dire a mani basse che sia uno dei migliori giochi a cui abbia mai giocato in tutta la mia esistenza. Parliamo di una storia interattiva in un universo di apocalisse zombie, dove ogni scelta che fai, influenzerà gli eventi che seguono e sul finale. Esatto, è quel tipo di storia! E non una storia qualsiasi, ma una storia ben curata, dai personaggi ben caratterizzati e soprattutto una storia EMOTIVA. Perché diciamocelo, questo gioco non solo ha un gameplay intuitivo e piacevole ed una storia fantastica, ma offre anche tutta una serie di emozioni che lasciano il segno, se vivi il gioco appieno, ti rimangono dentro. E' semplicemente perfetto, 10/10 e lo dimenticherei volentieri, solo per giocarlo e riscoprirlo ancora.

												If you enjoy suspense filled, story driven cinematic adventures.. or atmospheric trials of survival at its finest.. or simply came here because of the mainstream success of the television show and comics.. just know.. you will not be disappointed.  As of this post, only two of the five planned episodes have been playable, but the way the game puts you in direct control of a torn man and a little girl, as well as the future of other individuals they discover, is perfect and really does leave you with that anxious feeling of having to wait for a new episode or season of your favorite show. I truly believe this is a great piece of entertainment and well worth your time and money.  I do recommend, however, playing through each episode in one sitting, thus completely soaking in what just took place at your fingertips.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												I'm going to make this short, simple and spoiler free as possible.Buy this game, now!I have never really been a big fan of PaC(Point and click) games, however this is one of the best games I've ever played. I'm going to tell you right now, this is not a game you're going to play for gameplay, action or whatever. This is a game you're going to play for the story, which is the main focus. Think of this more as a interactive movie, or even more accurately , a show.  Gameplay is a relatively similar to other PaCs, though there are some very minor differences such as more focus dialogue and story.A short, spoiler-freeish summary of the story:You're  Lee Everett, a former professor of history at the University of Georgia who, for reasons I'll let you find out, was heading to jail...on the day of the apocalypse. However, you didn't make it. You later find a little 8 year old girl named Clementine, alone, and you decide to take care of her. This where the main point of the game comes in; Keeping safe, and taking care of Clementine, who you will end up caring about a lot. Telltale does a amazing job of making you care about Clementine, a game as never made Me as emotionally invested in characters as The Walking Dead does. There are, however, a few small performance issues and graphical bugs, but I found turning off AA(Anti-aliasing), setting shadows to low and having it run as administrator fixed most of the problems.I would go into more about the games story and all that, but I really don't want to spoil to much.Please just trust Me, buy this game, and it's DLC 400 Days. Even if you don't want to pay full price, then wait for a sale and ♥♥♥♥ing get it then!I promise you, you will not regret it!If I had to do a stupid score thing, I would give this game a 9.9/10 and 400 Days DLC a 5.5/10=======================================[Updated My review]After playing through season 2, I'm going to change My rating for 400 Days from a 8.7 to 5.5/10 and would also say that you could skip it, as choices you make in it are, in season 2 at least, pointless, and most of the characters, minus Bonnie, have nothing more then pointless cameos.

Posted: October 4, 2014
												Rating: 9.5/10This game manipulates your emotions in such a way that you actually start feeling you're in the game. It is really immersive. You somehow start caring about every character, feel bad for the ones that died, get angry at someone else, etc. No, it doesn't have great graphics or a lot of action. It is just a simple narrative, story-driven game where you won't have anything else to do rather than walking and clicking on stuff. But the way in which the story is narrated, the way the game gives you tough decisions to choose from, the great storyline it has, is what makes the game amazing.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Sadly, I watched gameplay of all of the episodes of this season, season two and the DLC. But, that didn't stop me from buying it. Even this late after release. From what I saw - It was an awesome and unique game, like no other. I have much respect for taletale for that. They did not care what was trendy and what the mainstream thought they wanted. Insted, they gave us a more immersive and emotionfull  experience. A really interactive story. Not only did you interact with the game, the game interacts with you. It makes you reflect your descisions, it makes you think of how things can go, about life, etc. It triggers the most humane part of us, when the world in-game isn't. It is the game I've always wanted in the back of my mind, for years.So, even after knowing how somewhat the story might turn out like, I played it and I will never regret it. I had forgot some of how the story went, and my own choices made it turn out differently - Which is what made the game even better. The atmosphere was amazing, I can tell you. Not going to spoil anything, but there were moments where I felt sad for what happend in the game, looking on how things might turn out if similar occations happens. The inner greedy and bitter will have their inner them, radicalized and so will the good ones. The good people will do any thing they can do, to avoid the worst possible occations, to avoid hurting people, to help people. But, how you are treated, can also make you bitter. That's what this game reminds me of - You have to keep up the spirit, fight for the good, fight for humanity, or at least what's left of it. Show your humane side, your inner good. I see myself in Lee, partly due to the descisions I make is what fits my personality, and thereafter his. He did everything he could to protect Clem. He lost his folks, and didn't hesitate once - He kept on moving.The only bad thing is that telltale told us that the story would be tailored, by how you play and the descisions you made. But, that is only partly through. There are tons of situations where I could've done something, but didn't get the choice, and often when I did get a choise, I didn't get enough. Like, being able to backstab someone (the ♥♥♥♥♥ Lilly). Such features are needed. More freedom of movement, and deciding where to go between several routes, not just to savannah. I hope they once pull up again that is better than this game on descision making, even though this one still is the best one out there. Because, if they so did - I would've done anything in my power to save Carley. I could've jumped in front of Lilly and saved Carley, or jumped at Lilly. No, this game doesn't give that ability, which sucks. Telltale, you better come up with another similar game that does this right, or if possible, release an update for this game, that does it. Heck, even open up for mod support, so people can fix that themselves.Still..This game is a piece of art. That's what it is, and not a single person can deny it. No other game has made be feel more emotional than this game, and making me emotional isn't easy. I usually never show emotions in my life, emotions are things I keep on the inside. While this game, managed to bring it out of me. I don't have words to describe this game. It's a true masterpiece, and if you haven't played the game already - You better do it!Hands down, best game so far.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												I'm going to make this short, simple and spoiler free as possible.Buy this game, now!I have never really been a big fan of PaC(Point and click) games, however this is one of the best games I've ever played. I'm going to tell you right now, this is not a game you're going to play for gameplay, action or whatever. This is a game you're going to play for the story, which is the main focus. Think of this more as a interactive movie, or even more accurately , a show.  Gameplay is a relatively similar to other PaCs, though there are some very minor differences such as more focus dialogue and story.A short, spoiler-freeish summary of the story:You're  Lee Everett, a former professor of history at the University of Georgia who, for reasons I'll let you find out, was heading to jail...on the day of the apocalypse. However, you didn't make it. You later find a little 8 year old girl named Clementine, alone, and you decide to take care of her. This where the main point of the game comes in; Keeping safe, and taking care of Clementine, who you will end up caring about a lot. Telltale does a amazing job of making you care about Clementine, a game as never made Me as emotionally invested in characters as The Walking Dead does. There are, however, a few small performance issues and graphical bugs, but I found turning off AA(Anti-aliasing), setting shadows to low and having it run as administrator fixed most of the problems.I would go into more about the games story and all that, but I really don't want to spoil to much.Please just trust Me, buy this game, and it's DLC 400 Days. Even if you don't want to pay full price, then wait for a sale and ♥♥♥♥ing get it then!I promise you, you will not regret it!If I had to do a stupid score thing, I would give this game a 9.9/10 and 400 Days DLC a 5.5/10=======================================[Updated My review]After playing through season 2, I'm going to change My rating for 400 Days from a 8.7 to 5.5/10 and would also say that you could skip it, as choices you make in it are, in season 2 at least, pointless, and most of the characters, minus Bonnie, have nothing more then pointless cameos.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
IntroductionThis game... wow... this game sure puts you on an exciting rollercoaster of emotions. The Walking Dead by TellTale Games, is a must-have game that needs to be in your steam library. I mean honestly, you and everyone else who doesn't have this game, should be throwing money at it.AtmosphereThe atmosphere in the game is simply astounding. If you decide to go heavy into this game (which you should, to get the most out of it), in tense moments of the game, you really feel it along with the characters. I found myself shedding a tear or so when something bad happens/happened. And at the end, oh boy did I turn into a fountain. Honestly, if you didn't shed a single tear at the end, congratulations! You're a psychopath.ChoicesChoices in this game are very impactful. Sometimes not so much, but a majority of them are. I won't spoil anything, but just be ready to make not only tough decisions, but fast ones as for most of the choices you have a certain time limit, which varies in length.MusicWhat kind of music is to be played when and where is simply gorgeous. To me, music can make or break a moment, deciding the factor whether you couldn't care less, feel horrible for the character, or be happy like the sun.RelationshipsTo kind of go along with the choices section, there are so many different relationships you can have with people. You can befriend Larry, or be an enemy with him, and so goes for Kenny and everyone else.NegativesThe only thing I can really put down about this game is some of it's realism and glitches. (yes, I know that it's a zombie apocalypse and it's not real, just a game der da duh), For example, at the start when Lee slips on some blood, the blow his head takes (giggity) should have killed him or immobilized him for a while. There are also some continuity errors such as "I only got one bullet left!" then shoots three bullets.PlotThe plot of "The Walking Dead" is great. It's involving and it's alot easier to remember since you're the one making the plot. This is just a quick, and basic run-down. (no spoilers ahead) You start off as Lee. He's on his way to prison when they are involved with a car crash. a little girl saves him and from then on they fight for survival.ConclusionOverall, I would highly reccommend this game to anyone a fan of story-based games, a point-and-click adventure or a fan of "The Walking Dead" television show or comic books. 9/10.

												Literally just completed the story... What an incredible journey this game took me on. Can't remember the last time I felt so strongly connected to a games set of characters, feelings, backgrounds... I've hardly touched this particular Point & Click game style before but I am pleased to say that through this Telltale experience I have thoroughly enjoyed it. I don't just feel like I'm experiencing the story, I'm controlling it! My decisions ultimately changed the way my story progressed. This is not something I've come across alot in games, therefore its great to see this being a unique feature in The Walking Dead.I can see now why its rated as "Overwhelmingly Positive". If you are one of the crazy people that haven't purchased this yet, go ahead and go for it. An unforgettable gem worthy of anyones time & money. Already have Walking Dead Season 2 to continue with, and will definitely be going through more Telltale games as a result of this.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												I decided to give a chance to TWD after seeing so many positive reviews. Although I like the zombie theme, the series never excited me and I never read the comics, I was surprised at how good and special this game is.I confess I had already tested other games from Telltale and didn't like, point and click adventures are not my thing, but with the TWD I liked the gameplay, it's a game focused more on plot, dialogues and interactions of the characters but that has a dynamic side, with situations in which you should have quick reaction. The graphics are cartoony and the game has great sound quality, effects, soundtrack and voice acting.It's the storyline and script that the game shines, thoroughly engaging and captivating, a story in which you must make choices that impact during the game and in relations with the characters, there impactful moments when it is impossible not to be touched, addition to all is the construction of the characters, their qualities, defects and emotions is perfect, the immersive factor is present in a unique way in this game. The DLC is a good length, although short, sets the stage for the second season, I have to say I enjoyed the game much more than the series, I highly recommend it to everyone, even those who don't have much interest in this kind of game.9/10

Posted: September 28, 2013
												I don't like zombie apocalypse games/movies. Possibility of it sounds for me really stupid - especially in our modern world with our GPS systems, payment purchases through fingerprints and fast Internet on the space station. But this game changed my opinion about zombies, because:1. This game magnificently shows you, how hard it is - to kill a zombie, which 10 minutes ago was a human with his own feelings, wishes, thoughts and memories.2. After 2-3 hours of game process you start thinking: who's worse - people or zombies, because all of them do awful things.About the game itself - it's brilliant. There isn't so much action, the whole game process is just point'n'click and sometimes QTE (with choosing phrases in dialogues). But the story and characters are wonderful. I would also like to note voices of characters, especially Clementine. Voices...well...impossible to describe it, actors did their best.Strongly recommended for:1. people, who want to see excellent story in the game2. people who like zombie apocalypse3. people who don't like zombie apocalypse (they will change their mind, as I did)imho, 10/10

content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												In this movie from critically acclaimed director Hillary Duff, you play as the titular "Walking Dude". As a spiritual successor to The Big Lebowski this film falls somewhat short, but that isn't to say that it's not an interesting piece when taken on its own. It explores complex themes well out of the range of its predecessor; in fact, much of the story is told through flashbacks to the first Gulf War. I wasn't expecting such stark political commentary! I was also especially fond of Steve Buscemi reprising his role as "Clementine". That man is a true master of his craft.Overall, I would give this jogo seven out of ten. John Marston dies at the end.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												First off, it's important to realise that this isn't an action game where you beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of zombies. It's more like watching episodes of The Walking Dead, making decisions for the character and thinking on your feet. Essentially, it's a story based game, which is really, really enjoyable, if you love The Walking Dead.Your character is Lee, a guy who got in some trouble with the police when the apocalypse hit. He meets a little girl, Clementine, and the pair embark upon a journey together, meeting different people along the way. The story itself is absolutely captivating, and rest assured, even the most indifferent of people will shed a tear by the end of this game. The story changes completely depending on which choices you make, which is really difficult for somebody as bloody indecisive as me, and I had to restart sections frequently because I'd felt my choice had been wrong. It's moral led, which makes it even more challenging, as you have to make difficult decisions about food sharing, lying to people you like and ultimately, saving people. The game is extremely engrossing and you can't help but get emotionally involved. This was the perfect 'Sunday' game for me. A game you can ultimately enjoy playing when you're feeling a bit rough from all the alcohol you had the night before (ahem). It is involving, enjoyable and tests your survival instincts - not just finding food and shelter, but also your manipulation or capitulation when dealing with other people. I absolutely recommend it, especially if you're a fan of the TV series or comics.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Wow what a gem this game is.  You play as Lee a man with a questionable past thrown in at the deep end at the start of a zombie apocalypse, at the start of the game you meet Clementine, a little girl alone.  Throughout the game Lee and Clem meet all sorts of characters and together try and survive in a world gone mad.The Storyline is dark in places and full of twists and turns but i felt myself constantly wanting more, it was like a book i couldnt put down chapter after chapter.There are lots of great things i can say about this game, the character development is some of the best i've seen in any game.  The dialogue is perfect, it really gives each character a personality and you get the feeling these people really exist.  With every conversation i found myself not just trying to say the right thing but voicing my own opinion as if i was the main character i was playing (Lee).  From dilemma's to arguements to simple discussions and decisions this is a game that will make you wonder a second later if you did or said the right thing.  The fact that almost everything you say or do has a lasting effect and moulds the game to your decisions amazes me.  The quicktime events are quite simple at times but then it really catches you off guard at other times where you near enough need lightning reflex's.I've never been a fan of cell shaded games but this is just something else, graphically it looks fantastic.By the end of chapter five i didnt want it to end, i felt a real deep connection to each of the characters, even more so with Lee and Clementine.Telltale did a fantastic job with this game and really can't wait for future installments of this series.9.5/10

content:
Posted: March 18, 2013
												I have never really been too fond of the Point-N-Click Genre, but when i bought this in a steam sale i was blown away. The main catch of the game is that you are Lee Everett a convicted murderer on his way to prison but shenanigans happen and you end up in the middle of a zombie apocalypse.The rest of the game has you solving ''puzzles'' (using the term loosely since most of the puzzles are Putt-Putt level). And making choices for you and your survivor group such as: ''Oh no, theres only 4 pieces of food for 10 people who do i give them to and why?'' and: ''Gawrsh! two individuals i just met are under attack by zombies! which one do i attempt to save first?''Its choices like that that have you wondering throughout the episode wheter you did the right thing or not, but more on that later. The dialog and bonding with the other survivors feels suprisingly good. All the characters are packed with intense, deep and sometimes even funny dialog.The game consists of 5 episodes which arn't very big and took me 2 - 3 hours to complete per episode. A cool addition thing is that the stats are tracked and displayed at the end of each episode so you can see what everything else did.The Walking Dead world is filled with a lot of clues, backstory and information about how other survivors perished and other humans adapted to their new threat.But all this praising? isn't there anything bad to say about this game? Sadly yes, a lot of characters have random moodswings and sometimes the conclusion of a choice you made feel weird, for instance. Theres a survivor which you meet at the beginning of the game and being my first pal and all i helped and supported him as much as i could through episode 1, but when i got to the end of episode 2 and disagreed with him about smashing an innocent persons brain in i got constantly berated by him about how i ''Never have his back!'' and that kinda spoiled the feeling of the game for me.In conclusion, whether you've read the comics or watched the show doesn't matter (some characters make cameos but its not much.) If you fully want to explore everything the game takes about 12 - 14 hours to beat and i'd say it's well worth buying if you're a fan of zombie games (keep in mind that this isn't a gun-toting game but rather an emotional rollercoaster.) or the Point-N-Click genre in general.Make sure you have a sturdy ''Q'' key though.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2012
												I've actually had this game for quite some time, but never really bothered to play it, due to a combination of not having seen the show and not really knowing what the game was even about. Finally I forced myself to stop procrastinating and pulled up the first couple seasons of the show on Netflix. Now that's another story entirely, but it pushed me to give in and boot up the game.The first thing to note is this game is EXTREMELY story-driven. There's little walking around and even less controllable combat. But that doesn't matter, because the story is amazing. The storyline and dialogue are very interactive, and at least half of the dialogue choices you make influence something in the game, whether it be how someone else feels about you, or a friend's fate. Excellent voice acting and music only add to the story, which, like the show, puts you on a roller coaster of emotions from anger to fear to sorrow. My only complaint is the texture quality is rather low in areas, but that can be overlooked. I very much enjoyed this game.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												The Walking Dead is one of the most brilliant things I have ever played. I've never been a fan of point and clicks, but my god, the story of this game. Never has so much emotion, tension and terror been wrote so well into a video game like this. This game made me cry, it made me make unspeakable decisions, and it did what no over game has ever done; it made me care about the characters Lee was with, as though they were my own freinds. My own family. I never gave up on them, and as I played the game further and further I felt everything slipping out of control till the inevitable end. And the thing I know is that it didn't all have to end like that. I could've saved people, and while I was playing I kept asking myself would it have been different and better for the characters if I had made choice A instead of choice B at point X in the game. This game makes you think about the world we live in, and it makes you feel overwhelming emotion toward the most real, most compelling, most engaging characters I have ever met in a game. I am in love with this game.I knew these characters for no more than 15 hours, yet they felt real to me. I genuinly did care about them. I can definatly see myself playing through this game again, trying out different choices, and seeing different paths. 10/10 Telltale are ♥♥♥♥ing writing wizzards.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												First off, it's important to realise that this isn't an action game where you beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of zombies. It's more like watching episodes of The Walking Dead, making decisions for the character and thinking on your feet. Essentially, it's a story based game, which is really, really enjoyable, if you love The Walking Dead.Your character is Lee, a guy who got in some trouble with the police when the apocalypse hit. He meets a little girl, Clementine, and the pair embark upon a journey together, meeting different people along the way. The story itself is absolutely captivating, and rest assured, even the most indifferent of people will shed a tear by the end of this game. The story changes completely depending on which choices you make, which is really difficult for somebody as bloody indecisive as me, and I had to restart sections frequently because I'd felt my choice had been wrong. It's moral led, which makes it even more challenging, as you have to make difficult decisions about food sharing, lying to people you like and ultimately, saving people. The game is extremely engrossing and you can't help but get emotionally involved. This was the perfect 'Sunday' game for me. A game you can ultimately enjoy playing when you're feeling a bit rough from all the alcohol you had the night before (ahem). It is involving, enjoyable and tests your survival instincts - not just finding food and shelter, but also your manipulation or capitulation when dealing with other people. I absolutely recommend it, especially if you're a fan of the TV series or comics.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												This is one of the rare games that reminds us of the importance of holding onto our humanity - even while making the incredibly hard decisions that can affect a group of (in-game) people. It's not about a series of random choices or making the "bad decision" just for the hell of it. The game makes you start to care about those choices. And who is to say, really, what the right or wrong decisions are in a time and place so desperate as the world full of the dead walking? One of the best moments came as early as Episode 2 - where Lee, the main character, is forced to divide up a few food rations among too many people. Obviously it was one of those agonizing decisions faced by the protagonist, but I found myself more moved by that one moment than by many of those big "AAA" titles, even the ones that focus on a huge, immersive story. I'd recommend this even for those who have never played an adventure game before, or think that by doing so, they aren't playing an actual video game. Certain points in the game require a quick decision or action, which makes this more than just a linear, interactive story. The Walking Dead has it all - great story, gripping plot, complex characters, nice visuals, and lots of content. In fact, I'd say this one game has more hours of content than a lot of more expensive titles out there. Unlike some adventure games, where decisions don't really affect the "big picture" outcome, this game will record early decisions and have them influence events in later episodes. Additionally, the vast array of choices and possible paths can add many more hours or additional playthroughs to an already great game. Highly recommended if you want something a bit different from the market's latest shoot-em-up zombie game.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Fun game, but get it on sale. This game represents a growing "genre" in video games that some have called "interactive storytelling." There isn't really a "game" in here, in the sense that you don't control everything your character does. This game reminds me of a rail-shooter (like house of the dead) except you don't have a gun and the few shooting sections that are in the game are terrible. No, this game is more akin to a point-and-click adventure that uses a lot of quick-time events and every now and again you can move your character around, woot! However, if you are a fan of point-and-click adventure games, or have an open-mind to that kind of experience, then none of what I have said so far is really a problem. This game's glaring flaw is as Morpheus once put it in The Matrix, the problem is choice. This game claims to give you tough choices that will completely change the outcome of the story, but that is a total lie. Almost every choice in the game has little-to-no effect upon the over-arching story. The only thing your choices affect are the relationships with other characters, but you will never find yourself in a different town/base with completely different companions, or that any of your choices have more than one outcome, as all of the big decisions are locked in. Many choices aren't even choices! For instance, (SEMISPOILER ALERT) early on you have to choose to save the life of two people in trouble, but it's not really a choice because one of them is a child! What monster would chooses the other person? By the way, it doesn't matter anyway, because no matter what you choose the child lives and the other person dies. See what I mean? Every decision is like this, so it really matters little what you choose. So if you get this game, get it on sale and play it for the enjoyment of the story, don't expect to make any waves with your decision-making skills.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
PriceI bought the entire season for 5.74€ during a steam sale.Introduction The Walking Dead - Season 1 is an by Telltale Games made episodic Point&Click game based on the comic book by Robert Kirkman, and AMC’s The Walking Dead and was released in 2012. It features lots of great characters and great storytelling.Graphics / Surroundings This game features just like any other Telltale game the cell shaded art style. Which looks fine for today’s standards, but this is not the focus of this game so we’ll look past that. In terms of open world there isn’t really anything, it’s a pretty linear game.AudioMusic is there but very lightly on the background sometimes, so you’ll barely notice. The voice acting was done very well though and this is a big pro for this game, it really makes this game feel way more like a tv show or movie. Which can be a pro or con for you.GameplayGeneralAs said this is a Point&Click game so there will not be that much to say here.You can’t really do much more than just follow the story and occasionally walk around and explore a little, sometimes you have to react in combat and occasionally you have to use a gun. StorySo this is where this game really shines, You play as Lee Everett, a convicted murderer who is given a second chance because of a zombie apocalypse. While looking for shelter and safety you come across a little girl named Clementine, whose parents were out of town when the apocalypse started. Together with her you will make a journey and along the way you will come across lots of different people, some will stay a for a longer time with you and some might go their own way. Your choices affect the story, so if you decide to be nice to people they might do something nice in return later on. Ones you meet some of the longer-staying characters you will have the option to check on them occasionally, if you do so it can help you later on or not.Performance / SettingsThis game ran just fine on my pc, there should be no difficulties here.Verdict98/1001. Must Buy2. Recommended3. Recommended On Sale4. Not Recommended5. Don't Buy

content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												This is one of the rare games that reminds us of the importance of holding onto our humanity - even while making the incredibly hard decisions that can affect a group of (in-game) people. It's not about a series of random choices or making the "bad decision" just for the hell of it. The game makes you start to care about those choices. And who is to say, really, what the right or wrong decisions are in a time and place so desperate as the world full of the dead walking? One of the best moments came as early as Episode 2 - where Lee, the main character, is forced to divide up a few food rations among too many people. Obviously it was one of those agonizing decisions faced by the protagonist, but I found myself more moved by that one moment than by many of those big "AAA" titles, even the ones that focus on a huge, immersive story. I'd recommend this even for those who have never played an adventure game before, or think that by doing so, they aren't playing an actual video game. Certain points in the game require a quick decision or action, which makes this more than just a linear, interactive story. The Walking Dead has it all - great story, gripping plot, complex characters, nice visuals, and lots of content. In fact, I'd say this one game has more hours of content than a lot of more expensive titles out there. Unlike some adventure games, where decisions don't really affect the "big picture" outcome, this game will record early decisions and have them influence events in later episodes. Additionally, the vast array of choices and possible paths can add many more hours or additional playthroughs to an already great game. Highly recommended if you want something a bit different from the market's latest shoot-em-up zombie game.

												I expected this game to be good, but nothing remarkable. So when I played through this game, I was stunned.This is yet another one of those guys that made me bawl like a little baby. The strength and power of the emotional bonds in this game are nothing short of exemplary. This game made my choices feel very impactful, and in my view not many games do that. There's a plethora of choices to make in this game, and it's very nice to see that each one has a significant outcome in your adventure.God, this game is amazing. You may argue about the gameplay being somewhat tedious and time-consuming, but it's the narrative and storytelling of this game that'll make you shed some serious tears. If you're not a fan of point-and-click adventures and you're expecting a fantastic adventure, this may not be for you.But if you're looking for a tragic and memorable story, by god is this a game for you!

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												The Walking Dead: Season 1, is well... a rollercoaster ride, really. While the cartoonish graphic which reminds some to the comic book might not appeal to those who prefer high quality, crisp images, the story is what draws people in. Out of all the games I played over the years, only a few sticks in my mind. Some because of sheer humor, stupidity and excitement; one is because of the multiplayer experience it has offered; others... well.. because they have 'infamous' reputations, good and bad depending on one's perspective. This game, was memorable in its own way. I'll start discussing the gists of the story, before going into the choices, graphics, etc.The story begins with the main character, Lee, in a cop car going to prison for a crime he commited. Let's just say, along the way, an 'accident' happened, and his life with the people he met along the way, changed forever. As society falls into disorder and chaos, the small groups that remained tried to maintain what is left of their humanity while hoping for the best. As the name of the game suggests, the situation doesn't improve and continues to deteriorate. To some people, they might not be able to handle the pressure. To others, it became a free-for-all. The fact is, when there is no rules, what stops a man from becoming a beast?Now, choices are one of the main driving force of the story. The game present us a story with choices, just like games before in the past have done so. But it is done in a more simpler way along with a *quicker* time limit, because you can't put down your computer and cook lunch while you have to decide which person you going to save from the undead that's going to rip them apart limb to limb. The choices in the game, are plenty and ranges from the typical 'good guy', the '♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥', or just *silent* which gives the player a more personalized experience as you got to choose your own choices. Nonetheless, as the name suggests, one would expect grisly scenes, and the game does not hold back on some moments in the game, giving the "WTF! I can't believe he/she did that!" reaction. However, this game also succeeds in capturing the emotions that the developers (probably) want the gamers to experience which comes from excellent voice acting, especially for the two main leads, Lee and Clementine, a little girl he met after the 'accident'. It is also interesting to see how the relationship between Lee and Clementine changes throughout Season 1. It happens so gradually, but when you realised it, she was able to stand on her own two feet and take care of herself. Another props for the degree of realism (as you can't really babysit a kid in an environment where quick judgement and thinking on your feet means you get to live another day. While Lee wants to protect Clementine, he knew that sooner or later, Clementine will have to deal with it.Now, we talk about the gameplay. The puzzles are fairly simple and not too challenging. While some people might want harder puzzles, I find it just okay as what I find that the puzzles are not the main points for the game. I also want to mention that luckily, I do not have glitches, as I have hear that other people playing the game encountered bad glitches. Luckily, there is none of that in my games and even though it may exist in other gameplays, it doesn't turn into a game-breaking one.Then, I want to talk about the ending. No spoilers. Why? Because I find that by knowing the spoilers, basically you were shown the magic trick before you see the show, which in a way, renders the excitement and experience of seeing it for the first time to almost nothing. You might be excited, but you wouldn't feel it the same way if you didn't know it from the beginning. Let's just say no tears are shed. I was just chopping onions with the invisible ninjas in the room. All I can say, Telltale managed to create a great game that can and will be set as an example for future games. Why?Well.. I guess, it is because of the story, the emotions, the human side of things. What I find is that games don't need to have high-end graphics, famous actors doing the voice-overs, and customizeable items. I guess, the 'human moment' where the characters interact with each other, it also affects us and as we unconsciously used our intuition and beliefs to make the decisions, we would feel the emotional impact as well i.e. when we save someone but couldn't save another, we feel dread. It might not be as dreadful if you don't spent much with the character-per-se, but when the choices include the characters we have spend a few episodes together, it becomes a much harder task.The Walking Dead is worth buying full price, even though I bought it during steam sales :PKeep that hair short.EDIT: I also nominated this game for "I'm not crying, there's something in my eyes" award

content:
Posted: September 11, 2012
GraphicsThe game is designed in a Cell Shading technology engine. Everything is simplified and realism is a matter of perception.For me personally; I'm a crazy comics fan, my dream is to make a comic book myself once in the future.Having checked the comic of the original The Walking Dead story, I say the game looks imspiring and I really liked it.The environment is simple enough to let your eyes go through the areas, and detailed enough to set up teh perfect mood for teh perfect moments.It's nothing like Borderlands I can tell you that. You may check trailers and you will understand.What we got here is a realistic comic story coming alive through animation.however, i noticed some bugs. not sure if its cos of my rig's age, but i noticed some very few bugs in the game.like a door animation missplacement once, or a face animation that was supposed not to be talking but the mouth was animated if it did.But well.. IMHO those were completelly minimal stuff to me. bugs exist in all games anyway so.Music and soundsMusic enough to let you concentrate on what you have to concentrate on.Pretty much is there, but doesn't take your attention away.No special soundtrack selections though no.Sounds and sound effect are pretty neat. Everything is simple and cool.Zombie sounds are pretty as amazing as i expected.GameplayThe game is focuses on a story, passing through your monitor's screen like a movie.The developer's said what you do matters on what happenes next, and they give you dialogue selections.BUT don't get it wrong. The story WILL take you into direct events and you will just have to follow that line.The only reason they give your those dialogue and action selections is to form the herp's character as you wish and affect the way the other characters see you and talk to you later on.You can be a good guy, a♥♥♥♥♥♥ a neutral person. the NPCs will remember your decisions and actions and it will affect their dialogies depending how much they trust or like you.Meanwhile the style of the experience is around the mood of an adventure game.Very basic moving controls, going through puzzling situations, examining items and landscapes and stuff.ControlsVery simple controls. W,A,S,D movement, itema nd action selections, left click for action.Using your cursor will help you look and investigate the places and items you want, aiming to kill zombies and generaly perform actions.The StoryIf you also are a fan of The Walking Dead, then your most def need to check this game cos then you knowhow awesome this zombie plot can be.If you are not then 2 things; either watch teh series first - cos the game contains a few spoilersor if you don't like the show just check teh game as a piece in your zombie fan collection.A warnign though. This is no happy candy smiley story here. We are talking about drama and crazy plot spins.If you like drama combined in a zombie story, then you will love this story for sure.The CharactersQuite a number of characters to meet in the game. The story leads you right to them anyway.The voicing is simple and nice. Each 'person' in the game has its own character and background story.You will have to interact, take decisions, gain their trust of ♥♥♥♥ them up. make friends or enemies.it was interesting for me going through the game, talking to all the characters, finding out about their motivations, trying to seek alies while in the middle of that survival horror you are places in.value/timeThe developers were smart enough to bring you the story in pieces.This way you still feel the need to see more and you never get bored.ATM there are 3 out of the total 5 chapters of the game available, each comes as a form of a free autoDLC updateallowing you to continue from where you left last time.The game is worth the while for zombie fans and fans of the specific comic or the show.I'm not sure how much it will last in time, probably not for much longer.The tv show is going to open the 3rd season soon and seems like there's a lot more ahead to see.So game developers will probably just end our game story at teh 5th chapter, and leave the ground free for Activisions FPS The Walking Dead game, coming (as said) on summer 2013.conclusionso yeah. recommended depending your tastes.for my tastes this game is TOTALLY RECOMMENDED.hope this review helped you.check screenshots and trailers if you like.also check this gameplay vid in the link bellow with little to no spoilers inside, it will help you take a look of what this is about.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
												This is a video game based on the comic book with the same title. Many of you may already be familiar with this as there's a TV show adaptation that is currently at its 4th season. To be honest, I never expected that a video game developer would come out with an adventure game based on this series instead of an action game (preferably, an FPS). Also, we know how rare adventure games are nowadays. So, its very existence is commendable and I can confirm Telltale Games did a wonderful job with it.The game, at times, feels like an interactive episode of the TV show. Rarely are you given the option to wander around and use many objects at your own pace. Gameplay is very easy: there are objects / people clickable so that your protagonist can interact with these. Occasionally, you get to make choices. These choices determine who will survive. I liked this as there are no good or bad decisions. Regardless of which decision you have made you'll anger some of the survivors that tag along with you while others will like you much better for the choice you've made. The game employs a third-person perspective but there are many scenes where the camera angle is different and gives the game a more cinematic feel. In case you are attacked by a walking dead you have to quickly react otherwise its game over. I did not like these as some of these QTEs (quick time events) were quite annoying and required a fast reaction. Other times gameplay was at my leisure so these break-ups I did not particularly like. Decisions you make carry over to the next episode and will also affect the end game in Episode 5. Some will help you when in need while others retaliate for not assisting them early on. I liked this concept and I found the story very, very dramatic. It is unusual for a video game to be this sad. You grow to like the characters and you feel really bad when they are overcome by the walkers.My review is based on Season 1. I liked it a lot so I'll definitely purchase and complete Season 2. The only downside of the game is the 400 Days released. It was a DLC and I believe it was too short and was not worth of its money. Still, if you like adventure games and miss those good-old point-and-click games released by LucasArts Walking Dead can bring back some really good memories.

Product received for free
												Obviously if you've heard of walking dead you probably have an idea that this game is about zombies. I haven't read the comics, but I have watched the television series. My initial thought was it was going to be a game that had the television characters in here and basically replaying the episodes via games. However, they have a different storyline going on in Georgia, where convict Lee finds a young girl Clementine that he takes it upon himself to protect. Along the way Lee and Clementine meet other survivors that he must make difficult decisions with. Like most telltale games, this has a set of different choices you can make. Although at times I feel like any choice I make seems to have a negative connotation, I really loved the storyline. The ending was satisfying, and it led me to really want to continue on to season 2. There isn't a whole lot of action, and the puzzles are difficult to solve. Really, this game is just a sit and enjoy type of playing.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2013
												Good game, nice story, responsive controls. It pretty much got everything right. I specifically enjoyed the time aspect of the conversations. Opposed to other point and click adventure games, you can't take too much time before selecting what to say next, it tries to emulate a realistic conversation by putting pressure on the player.Which is interesting and it pulls it off pretty nicely.Graphic wise it's decent. Not bad but not amazing either. The cell shaded textures look nice but some of them are visually pixelated, especially when the camera gets up close. The animations weren't impressive either, however the game excels in gameplay and decision making.You will be often times surprised by a very difficult choice that you have to make... all that under the time pressure.I recommend this game, it was a good experience!

Posted: May 26, 2014
												This game is amazing! This game is probably one of the best games I've ever played. It's not number one but it's up there. I decided to get the game since it was on sale so I don't spend as much money. Well, i'm glad I bought it. I would even buy it if it wasn't on sale! The voice acting is amazing as well. It fits the characters perfectly. Your choices is what makes the game more interesting. It's not just one storyline that the Developers decided to stick with. They wanted YOU to decided the end. You never know how it might end which makes the game a very good game. Love the comic/cartoon graphics of this game. It also fits the game perfectly. I'd give this game a 10/10. I highly recommend it if you're up for a nice story. P.s. I HATE Larry

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 4, 2014
												This game is all character development. If you think there's going to be a lot of action, you're wrong. The gem of this post-apocalyptic wasteland is the time you spend bonding or identifying with the characters. The story moves forward and forward, and only one thing remains constant in this game; Lee and Clementine's bond. Above all else, think about Clementine, because Lee is there with his manly soothing voice. In all seriousness, the game is GREAT. A lot of solving puzzles, defusing situations, and learning how each person stands in a situation. There are only a few hard choices compared to the second season, but assuming you choose the right choices, this ride of a game will take you from neutrality to empathy, to sadness, and then just misery. You're going to be flat-out bawling like I did when I finished this. The 400 Days Expansion is also worth its money, because it too affects the second season and any person that plays this game and finishes will crave more anyhow. This game is well done by TellTale, and always remember:                                                 Duck is a detective.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2016
												I voted "No" as a warning to people who expect this to be a game. It is NOT. It is a movie where you occasionally get to do some clicking and solve (very simple) puzzles. Don't expect to be kill zombies all around (although you get to kill some).+ The game represents the atmosphere of zombie-overrun world very precisely+ The comic-styled graphics are a brilliant idea - Your choices does not matter. Seriously. You can be cruel or nice - in the end the result is the same. Sometimes you get to choose who dies and who lives but that's only temporary. BTW - the minus point is actually part of the whole "The Walking Dead" franchise idea. The only thing that matters is to survive. Again - it is a nice but it hardly classifies as a game. So don't spend money on it if you really expect to "play" The Walking Dead.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												The Walking Dead Season 1 weaves poignant story-telling and beautiful art to create a game that I can only describe as a masterpiece. This point-and-click adventure game features excellent character development and a well-paced plot which serves to maximize immersion. Even if you are not familiar with the Walking Dead in other mediums (i.e. the TV show or comics), you will find yourself attached to the characters in this game. Every heart-wrenching decision you make has consequences, some large, some small, and you will often find yourself wondering if you made the right choice.Keep in mind, however, that this is not an action game. Don't look to this game for any sort of combat or survival mechanics. The purpose of the game is to tell a story, and it is an amazing narrative about love, loss and morality. If this is what you are looking for, then I would HIGHLY recommend the Walking Dead Season 1.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												This will be a short review, because there's not too much about this game I can say that will not spoil this game. Based off Robert Kirkman's critically acclaimed 'The Walking Dead' comic book series, this game is a point-and-click narrative adventure; you control a character named Lee, who has to fight to protect a young girl named Clementine in the wake of a zombie apocalypse.Told over five episodes, TWD is played out like a typical point and click adventure; click on items, click on dialogue bubbles and click on areas to make Lee move. You'll rarely be in direct control of the action, but this is a strength rather than a weakness. You're a viewer of a cinematic masterpice, along for the ride, who chooses Lee's every word and makes every decision for him. The decisions you make will affect your relationships with other characters and ultimately affect the way Clementine views you and acts the way she does. The voicework and visuals is phenomenal, and allows you to experience the game just the same as a film or a television series. The story is brilliantly told, and you'll find yourself genuinely caring about the characters as events unfold, which is a damn marvel in today's gaming industry.The Walking Dead is a unique and entertaining game, with emphasis on narrative and character development unlike any other game I've ever played. You'll remember the ending long after you finish the game, which only serves to demonstrate the quality writing exhibited by Telltale. 10 / 10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												*For Those Of You Looking For An Honest, Detailed Review*Gameplay: For those of you that don't know, this game is more of an interactive movie, as opposed to a fully imersive game, but that doesn't make it any less interesting. Some people say that you're decisions do not actually impact the story which is kinda true and kinda false. The decisions that do impact the game tend to be a 2-choice decision usually deciding which people survive and those that don't. Other conversations that have 3-4 options tend only to result in slightly varied dialouge which all end up at the same conclusion. Also, your answers to those "impacting" questions will be re shown at the end of each episode showing what percentage of other players made the same decision as you. Kind of a nify addition.Controls: I actually streamed the game to my laptop from my desktop, and played it in bed with a controller. This game is perfect with controllers considering that most of the time you're not pressing more than one button at a time. On occasion you'll have to aim and shoot quickly, but it's not nearly as fast paced as an FPS. Story: Ohh.... THE FEELS.... This story, just like the Walking Dead TV show (Which I am a huge fan of) the game focuses less on the "Senseless zombie killing rambo god♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; and more on the drama, trauma, stress, and conflict that can come to those survivng the zombie apocalypse. Here is a breif Synopsis: (Mild spoilers):Your name is Lee. You have been arrested for murder, and are on your way to jail when the cop driver hits something on the road and swerves into a ditch. You wake up to the Zombie Apocalypse. You eventually manage to flee your way into a nearby neighborhood where you meet Clementine - the most sweetest, kickass, little girl you will ever meet. Clem and Lee then decide to make their way to Savannah, where Clem's parents were supposedly staying. Along the way you make many friends, have some heart breaking losses, and are faced with situations that I hope I never have to face in real life.Throughout the game, you will learn so much about your fellow survivors that you will consider them family. And I swear that unless you are some heartless, emotionless, souless monster, this game will hit you right in the feels as well.Graphics: The story is enough, If you only consider games if they have Triple-A graphics, then shoo, we don't like you're kind.I hope this honest review helped sway some of you into buying this awesome game!

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												The Walking Dead is a graphic adventure, played from a third-person perspective with a variety of cinematic camera angles, in which the player, as protagonist Lee Everett, works with a rag-tag group of survivors to stay alive in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. The player can examine and interact with characters and items, and must make use of inventory items and the environment. Throughout the game, the player is presented with the ability to interact with their surroundings, and options to determine the nature of that interaction. For example, the player may be able to look at a character, talk to that character, or if they are carrying an item, offer it to the character or ask them about it. According to Robert Kirkman, The Walking Dead game is focused more on developing characters and story, and less on the action tropes that tend to feature in other zombie-based games, such as Left 4 Dead. In my opinion this is the perfect and I rate it a solid 10/10 a must buy!

Type: Single Player, Story Driven Point and Click Game.Pros+ Great visual design.+ Excellent writing and voice over performances across the board.+ Characters are filled with depth and morality is more often than not more grey than black and white in this title.+ Simple puzzle design works in this title's favour, as its meat lies in its story and characters.+ Engaging story that has the capacity to draw emotion out of the player themselves.+ Fantastic sound design and music that adds layers of ambiance to the title.Cons- While necessary, the QTE elements of this game can be tedious at times, but they complement the tension filled moments they accompany quite well. - Scene transitions can be iffy due to the game's engine.Get this if you enjoyed: Life is Strange; The Sam and Max Series; The Secret of Monkey Island Series; Full Throttle.

content:
Posted: April 14
												Really enjoyed this. Not really a fan of the TV show, but I've had a blast playing this game. Really well-executed gripping moments, great characters, and a charming art style. As expected, the game centers around a small group of characters who are trying to survive the zombie apocalypse, having to deal with not only the undead walkers, but also bandits and heated disagreements between one another, which at times lead to explosive conflicts. The game especially focuses the most on the father-daughter type relationship between Lee, the main character, and Clementine, an 8-year old girl he meets at the start whose parents have succumbed prior to the start of the game. Their relationship is very deep, emotional, and was pulled off very well, making you care for both characters. There are many difficult decisions presented throughout all 5 episodes, whether it is having to choose which of the two characters who are in danger to save, choosing to mercy kill someone or not, deciding which character to side with in arguments inside the group whilst losing trust with the other character, and so on.As with most Telltale games, there are quick-time events present every now and again, requiring you to act quickly. Most, aside from maybe 1 which comes to mind, are pretty easy enough so not to be offputting for those players who hate QTEs (like myself). A few catch you off by surprise, but the game saves very frequently between the cutscenes, so even if you die, you only lose like 10 seconds of progress.A very touching story overall. Between this game and Wolf Among Us, I think Telltale has become one of my favourite developers. Not sure why I've not gotten into these games earlier. Even if most choices in them lead along a linear story path and have little effect on the outcome, the stories themselves are crafted so well that they simply absorb you into their world. I'm sure going to be checking out season 2 of this and other Telltale games in the near future.

												Wow, why don't you own this yet? While somewhat lacking in the puzzle solving elements which are a staple in most point and click adventures, Telltale focus on creating an incredibly immersive story with characters you actually care about. Some of the choices you have to make in this game will really hit you hard and has genuine repercussions instead of just black or white, along with some truly shocking moments throughout the five episodes. I haven't enjoyed a game storyline this much since Deus Ex: Human Revolution. I've not really been a fan of Telltale's games in the past but what they've achieved with The Walking Dead is nothing short of amazing. This is my first delve into The Walking Dead universe and I was just hooked from the start right until the end. You'd be doing yourself a great disservice by not picking this game up as you are in for such a treat. Highly, highly recommended!

Posted: July 7, 2013
												This is not the perfect interactive novel but what Telltale's The Walking Dead is a classic tale of human survival whose foundation is built on solid voice acting, great visuals and masterful writing that conveys the difficulty and emotion of human interaction when the sh*t hits the fan like no other work in it's genre that I've experienced.    Other notes. 1) After each episode I didn't watch "Up Next on The Walking Dead".  No option to turn this off.  2)  Turn on Detect Selectables and Turn off Story Notifications.   Pixel hunting is not what this is about.  3) There are a few sequences where the lack of inverted controls can cause issues for people that are not comfortable with non-inverted controls in the first person.  4) If you're not a fan of this genre play it anyway, it's that good.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												One of the greatest games created by TellTale.Based off of the comic series of the same name, The Walking Dead places you in the shoes of Lee Everett: a convicted criminal who must now survive in a zombie apocalypse. While trying to survive he runs into other survivors, most notably a little girl named Clementine. It's up to Lee to protect Clementine from both the undead and the living.With the exception of a few minor characters who only appear in episode 1, The Walking Dead is not connected to the main plot of the comics, so even if you haven't read the comics or watched the show you can still fully understand this game.The game is a point and click adventure that focuses more on the struggles of surviving/solving puzzles and less on mindlessly murdering hundreds of zombies (though there still are some action sequences). This will probably scare away most buyers, but the people who can get past this will find themselves enjoying one of the most emotional games available on Steam (to those that DO want a mindless Walking Dead shooter, you can purchase the mediocre Walking Dead: Survival Instinct for double the price of this great game).Along the course of the game you'll be able to make certain choices that may affect who lives/dies or how others treat you. Although these choices don't really lead to any major "alternate paths", they are enough to making yourself feel responsible for every choice you make. You may be tempted to redo your playthrough so you can redo one choice you made, but it's honestly better to just keep going since it'll make your current playthrough much more meaningful.Every survivor in the game is fleshed out and has something that makes them unique. Whenever a main character dies you will almost always have a rush of emotions - whether it be anger or sadness. Unlike most zombie games you will actually care about the main characters and how things turn out for them. Overall, there are some really amazing moments in this game that may leave your eyes running.I wish I could go into detail about how great each episode is, but I don't want to spoil them. Even if you aren't a fan of The Walking Dead comics - or zombie culture in general - you will absolutely love this game.

Posted: April 8, 2013
												Aside from some rather odd game mechanics which take a little getting used to, this is quite possibly the most emotionally resonant video game EVER MADE.  An amazing story, excellent characterisations and voice acting, and a feeling of actual involvement in events beyond just shooting stuff (or copping sleazy lap-dances, a la GTA).  ♥♥♥♥ers even nearly made me cry a few times...which hasn't happened since the climax to Bioshock 2 (what is it with these manipulative ♥♥♥♥ing game designers and appealing to the paternal instincts of male gamers to protect loveable little girls?  Paging Dr. Freud)...   Anyway, if you don't believe that mere video games can have all the narrative impact of a great feature film - yours truly certainly being in that category before playing this - and are adventurous enough to try a game which is ultimately more about hardcore decision-making than brutal violence - though it certainly has its fair share of that, too - then give it a go.  "Interactive storytelling" at its very, very best.Verdict: 9.5/10.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												[Note : This review applies to both Season 1 and Season 2 taken together but applies to each one individually]Before buying this game, I didn't expect anything special. I knew it had good reviews and that's why I tried it.It turned out to be by far the BEST COMMERCIAL PRODUCT I've ever bought in my LIFE, better than any movie, game, book or anything else I've ever bought so far. The game genre is said to be a "Point'n'Click", but in fact it isn't that much ; there is no puzzle, there is just the story, and you implicated in it.I couldn't say this is a "game" though, you won't play, but you will be told a story, a beautiful story in witch you will be emotionnaly implicated as long as it speaks you to. Basically, I could say that the game is a big cutscene that you influate by your actions (by what you say in fact, choosing how to answer to the main characters). I KNOW that it sounds strange or bad, but it isn't, there is no way to properly describe how good this "game" is. To be a bit more clear, I would only see 3 reasons why someone could not like a game like that : ● They don't like cell-shading graphics (look at the screenshots)● They absolutely hate stories that take place in a Zombie Apocalypse environnement● They don't have a good English Level or don't know how to Install translations (2nd Season is in Full-English)Pros : + Incredibely good voice-acting and credible characters+ The way you are emotionally implied in the story, never had I seen that before in ANY game+ The possibility to "influence" the story and that you always feel that what's happening is because of your choices+ The whole story is intense, everything is useful, there would be no part to scrap down, I wasn't bored a SINGLE SECOND.+ Clementine as a deuteragonist (Season 1) and protagonist (Season 2), Tomboys as a main character FTW. :heart:+ The story is in NOW WAY predictable, you never know what will happen next. + Incredibly good "filming" and animation and character facial expression, as good and even better than most TV Series.+ The end... really... only time I cried in a Video Game. + Good Music (special mention for the End Credits)+ Simple controls : WASD + Mouse+ There is no need of a Gaming PC to run this, most computers will do the job+ You don't play this game, this is the game that plays youCons :- It has an end... no really... NO CON(-) Can have some resolution problems that can be fixed by the simple addition of a line in the start options on Steam(-) Translations in other languages than English are fan-made, the one for Season 2 isn't included with the Game ; play in English if you could for maximal effect. Conclusion : A MUST-TRY (at least in Sales, and at least for Season 1), 11/10 : best "game" and product I've ever purchased in my life ; I know that every game I'll play for a decade will surely not be as good as this one ; this was a once-in-a-lifetime experience, THANKS Telltale Games =) + please, Clementine again in Season 3 :beg:PS. There is absolutely no need to know the Comic Series or the TV Series "The Walking Dead" to enjoy this game, the story is an original one based on the Comics. PSS. You will certainly need a little time to fully enter in the story, try to play at least 2 hours before saying that you definitely don't like it or you could miss something. PSSS. You need to play this "game" ALONE for a maximum effect.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												I wrote a recommendation when this game first came out. On the first 5 minutes, I was hooked, and I said it was a 'great game.' However, after playing to the very end, I now understand the previous recommendation did not do this game the justice it deserves. It did not even come close.This game was brilliant. I will not reveal what happens, but the game's ending is the most heart-wrenching video game moment I have ever seen. The graphics may not be that of a 2012 game, but the pure excellence of this game is worth more than all the graphics in the world. Never have I seen a game that gives you a chance to create such a strong bond with all the characters that you meet, even the ones that didn't particularly like you. Throughout the entire story, I was on the edge of my seat, even after the last credit rolled off the screen. With astonishing writing, compelling characters, a heart-wrenching ending, and a strong emotional consistency, this game is - without a doubt - THE best game of 2012.Fellow gamers, whether you like zombie games or not, hear me out: play this game.You will not be disappointed.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												Right in the feels.The Walking Dead is an adventure RPG in the vein of old style point and click games. You are tasked with moving the protagonist through a series of puzzles and decisions through a point and click interface. You meet a lot of characters who all react to you and your decisions in different ways. Decisions you make can result in anything from someone being angry with you to the direct death of a main character. The characters are all memorable. All of them.The puzzles are fun and not too difficult to solve. The game is more about the other people and how you treat them and acti infront of them.You should play this game for the story if nothing else. The story is fantastic and the decisions you make hold weight. It's kind of an interactive choose your own adventure book.The art style is very enjoyable and the writing is some of the best. I can't talk about the plot too much at the risk of spoiling it but I will say that it is a very satisfying story.I really enjoyed this series of tales and highly recommend you play them!

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												Let's begin by saying that The Walking Dead isn't so much a game as an interactive "choose your own adventure" book. There are a few action sequences but for the most part you are interacting with the different characters you meet and making decisions about what you should do at different decision points. These decisions have repercussions on what happens in the story.As a game it isn't very entertaining to be honest. As a story it is both bleak and potentially inspiring depending on how you look at it. Had I paid full list price I would have been greatly disappointed in both the game play and the length of the game. However, on steep sale this isn't a bad way to spend 8-10 hours or so. Just don't go into it expecting a happy ending or really even closure to the story as this is "Season 1" of a longer story arc.
