content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
The Walking Dead sits firmly in what is the experience of this story told across graphic novels, the TV series, and this game. The game mechanics remind me, in a good way, of my childhood experiences with Choose Your Own Adventure books; the most notable difference that the choices not only affect your outcome, but the outcome of those that are surviving with you as well. TellTale's art style and storytelling are top notch, and the experience is worth the price of admission, in my opinion. They are definintely setting the bar for episodic game entertainment.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												Lots of nice situations, often times without the option you would want.. but what do you expect - and it all goes down alright for the sake of story.The game is quite good, quite lengthy and the final chapter quite impressed me. I enjoyed it as a whole and I recall a lot of it despite playing the 5 seasons over approximately 18 months.There are some great characters and some great situations. The game holds your hand a lot, but it's mainly a story-telling experience anyway - the only issue I had with the gameplay was the lengthy *actions* that can trigger if I clicked something twice, which you might do if you think that your character (Lee) might have the same insight you have (not often the case). Nonetheless, the game is fun and I recommend you play it, though probably picked up on a good sale tbh.My biggest peeve was that a good number of episodes were driven by character interactions between your group, but the game never presented me with the option I wanted (namely who I should be accusing). I found it weird as much of the game was about managing relationships AND ACCUSATIONS, but the time that I most wanted to accuse somebody of the poison that saw massive change (and the loss of the single group member that I wanted to keep), there was no option to remove the single most destructive group member (my opinion for a while before that happened, and ultimately proven by the end of the game to be your *worst* team member).I hope Telltale Games grow a pair and tell their funding groups that they want to make a more ambitious game. From what I've heard, they may already have done so.

												This is the first review I've done where I'm gonna be completely straight with everyone.This game is f'ing amazing. Even at full price, buy it. content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
												This is one of the best story games I have ever played, it might not be like GMod, CS:GO or GTA V but it's amazing, one of the best of it's genre, pretty much all computers could run it! My computer can't run most games on 60 frames, but this game did just that, the least fps I saw was 20 and that was for a split second when the game was loading. In this game you control someone called Lee Everett, at the beginning of the game you are in a car with a cop because you did a crime, you murdered a guy that was sleeping with your wife (That pretty much doesn't matter in the whole game,but it does get brought up a few times} And in the car the cop is asking you questions and turns around to look at you, best driver of 2016 right? And when he does so a walker/zombie is walking across the street and you crash, later on you meet a girl called Clementine and so on, you meet other survivors such as Larry and Kenny, don't want to spoil too much so that's all I'm gonna say, in this game there are 5 "Episodes". these are just parts of the game, in every episode you have to make a decision, there's always at least one big decision, and some small choises in dialouge, whenever you speak to someone you get 4 or less choises to say, you can actually change relationships in the game, if you were nice to someone, they'll be your friend (No♥♥♥♥♥♥sherlock) but you can also be a♥♥♥♥♥♥to them,  the game doesn't have much action but it's still amazing I've had this game for about 5 hours but it's still amazing, I would recommend getting it on G (2) A because it's less than 4 dollars there :D (It doesn't allow me to put those letters together,  the first letter is g, then it's 2, then it's a then it's .com) Have fun :D(This is pretty much the tl;dr)Pros:Can run on almost any computer at 60 fpsYou can change the way other people think about youGood storyGood characters (If one dies chances are you'll cry)Inbetween:Emotional at some partsCons:Not much actionGame is quick

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												+ Great story+ Realistic and graphic world+ Forces you to make tough choices- Annoying quick time events don't add anythingNot really a game, but an interactive story, so be warned, there is almost no gameplay here! Very compelling story, which forces you to make tough choices, that make you wonder what would happen if you had chosen differently. After each chapter, it shows you how your choices compared to everyone else who played the game, which is cool. Turns out I'm kind of a jerk, lol. In the end though, the results are always the same. I won't give anything away, but it turns out some of your gut-wrenching decisions don't really matter because certain events have to happen to push the story down the rails it's on. However, your choices affect how those events play out, which is satisfying. It's loaded with quicktime events that try to make you feel like part of the action, but I found them to be annoying. Why bother making me sit up and mash a button every 15 minutes or so after I just got comfy in my chair? Loved the art, which made it feel like a comic book. Great soundtrack, too. Very atmospheric.84/100A great story that explores some very grim realities if humanity was ever faced with a viral epidemic. Should have just focused on being a choose-your-own adventure than trying to force a 'game' element in. Not for the ADD crowd who like to skip cutscenes.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
												Oh man. Okay, so hear me out. 'The Walking Dead' AMC's hit TV series is a huge thrill ride with character connections and diverse story lines. I bought this game because I figured I enjoy the TV series. I did not expect what I have witnessed playing through this game. Take up the role of the main protaganist, Lee while you battle out an adventure against walkers and look after a girl called Clementine right until the bitter end. Choosing and interpreting the game to see how you see fit with different speech and actions which alter the story you play completely. As I write this review my eyes are leaking and my fingers shaking. "This game ♥♥♥♥ed me up, quite frankly". Buy it or regret it. If you want an emotional thrill ride with intense action and anticipation who enjoys gameplay and mulitple story lines, buy this♥♥♥♥♥♥now. If you're a graphics ♥♥♥♥♥, however, ♥♥♥♥ off back to Call of Duty or whatever♥♥♥♥♥♥you play. 37/10

content:
Posted: November 29, 2012
												The Walking Dead isn't just "a great videogame story." No, it's simply "a great story."  Don't let the tired concept of zombies put you off this game. The zombie apocalypse is merely a delivery mechanism for incredibly written human drama on display. Life's never easy. Tough decisions must be made, and in a world already gone to hell where there is no good and bad or right and wrong, all you can do is own your choices and pray you and your friends can scrape your way through another night among the dead.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Personal Rating: 10/10This game is a masterpiece. I played the Xbox version and picked it up on Steam because the Xbox version was a bit iffy. This review WILL NOT contain spoilers by the way. The story is beautifully crafted, a truly amazing narrative as you follow the survival of Lee Everett and a whole host of different characters, from redneck man, old man and nerd man. This team of rapscallians take on the world of zombies, people and possible death by boredom. The graphics are fantastic, using a cell shading sort of thing almost like Borderlands did, it fit's the game perfectly, I can't imagine the game having a different sort of graphical style at all. The choices you make in this game are excrutiatingly difficult to make and do have an impact, whether it be choosing between two people or giving out food to someone. While it's been a while since I played the third, fourth and fifth episodes, I do remember the choices you have to make.Another thing this game has, is the fact that it's possibly the first and only game to have made me cry and feel emotionally invested to such a large extent. It's amazing how they did this and I commend Telltale for this.It's a beautiful game and for the price it's at, it's like stealing food from a survivor. There is quite literally nothing wrong with this game, maybe the occasional bit of lag or stuttering but other than it's truly, truly marvellous.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
NOTICE: This review was originally written for the Xbox 360 version of the game and may not entirely reflect the PC version. The full, unedited version of this review may be viewed HERE[www.trueachievements.com].Walk a Mile in Their ShoesTelltale Games is no stranger to adventure games, and The Walking Dead is no stranger to success lately. A rapidly growing zombie mythos, The Walking Dead has hit the media trifecta with this game: literature, film, and gaming. But can this last piece of the puzzle equal the overwhelming acclaim of its other pieces?Telltale's five episode series is self-admittedly more in tune with the Walking Dead comic books, and does not branch off of the television show. While set in the Walking Dead mythos, the plot and characters are original and unique. Furthermore, you do not even have to be a fan of the series in any form to appreciate this riveting, nerve-wracking journey. This review contains no spoilers but concerns the series as a whole, not the individual episodes. The review is broken up into segments with concise summaries immediately following each.GraphicsPros:-Decent graphics for the price-Style is reminiscent of comic series-What little user interface there is, is partially customizable to tailor to your playstyleCons:-Nothing spectacular, no stand-out locations, just-enough-for-the-job visualsSoundPros:-Voice actors exceptionally well suited for their respective characters-Script and acting for bulk of game is captivatingCons:-Cannot skip dialogue, meaning thorough players will rehear a lot of potentially bland scriptPlotPros:-Huge focus on plot leads to a captivating drama-Player choices can shape character opinions, dialogue, and cutscenes-Each episode delivers a powerful punch of plot, but also contributes to the plot as a wholeCons:-Hard pressed to think of anyGameplayPros:-Gameplay choices lead to a plot tailored for you-Rewind feature makes it possible to second-guess your choices, if unhappy with outcome-If connected to the internet, choice synopsis at end of each episode compares you to others-Control over dialogue, “struggle” sequences, and suspenseful sequences immerse the player-Simple enough to be enjoyed by casual Walking Dead fans looking to enjoy this title-Few to no glitches or bugsCons:-Hardcore adventure players may not be satisfied with the puzzles, or lack thereof-Players not fond of visual novels may dislike the large focus on dialogue and plot-Slow readers may struggle with timed dialogue choicesLength/Replay ValuePros:-Although short, delivers a powerful gaming experienceCons:-Not the best money-to-hours ratio-Very little replay value (full game – players may use rewind to experience different choices)Total Score: 8.2/10

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												This is an amazing experience, now if you are looking for a "game" in the sense of "shoot everything, go where you want etc." then this isn't for you, stop reading, i'll wait...i said stop....DUDE I SAID, oh wait, u don't mind that? well lets continue shall we?This is an amazing Story based game (or interactive story based on your feelings), it keeps me wanting more and more to find out what was next.You Play a man called Lee Everett, you begin In a Police car for murder, after an acident you are thrown into this new zom-zom filled world (Fun times!)After looking for help you come across a young girl called Clementine, her parents are nowhere to be seen, and this is start of a great story.You will meet many great characters on your journey with Lee and Clem, some you will love and some you will hate, but the good thing is you care one way or the other.You will also have to make hard decisions, who gets to eat? what is the best course of action? why does duck not shut up? many things to be thought about.Will you do right for the group? Clem? Yourself? its up to you my friend (although if i hear you hurt my little girl i will hunt you down and get revenge....or ask for cookies as recompense)The only downside i would say to the steam version is the Full Price, seems a little bit high compared to PS3 and Xbox, however if you can grab it in a sale, or its sounds like your cup of tea, then please give this a go, i feel you won't regret it (or maybe you will, if you do then...oops, my bad i suppose)This is an amazing experience, my favorite game of all time and something that shows games don't need to permently put a gun in your hand to experience something, 10/10 from me.

												I cried,  cried real tears at the ending. Hot damn I haven't cried that bad since Marley and Me,Fantastic game, I loved it and if you're a fan of The Walking Dead then you'll love it too.There isn't too much in the way of gameplay, the action scenes take place in quicktime events which can be a little annoying as you'll die occaisionally but the main strength of this game is in the drama which is far better than any you will find in the TV shows (although maybe a little less mature than the novels or comics). However, I could see myself replaying this at least once or twice just to make different choices. I probably wouldn't pay full price but it's a must have in a sale (I got it at 75% off).

												This game is awesome, i love it! I play for 3 days now and i am a believer now! A few quicktime-events are a bit clunky, but it works... and isn *t a game-breaker at all. Needed some time to addept to it, but now it works well for me.Best positive things to mention:Diverse and coulerfull charakters, everyone with personal goals you have, to deal with to hold the group together.Everything is fresh and new and is a totally new story, so you don *t play the story of the Tv-series. It 's just a little bit mixed up with characters you also find in the series, but the story unfolds in a different way so you get surprises and it 's hard to trust new group-members.I enjoyed every single moment i played the game, because everything you decide will cause meaningfull actions, so you really have do decide wisely and with caution.Little downside for me are the quicktime-events, i get along with now, but could be a bit more fluid.... and bit easier to handle. Sometimes, before you find the mouse-curser to aim on your foe you are already done, so you have to act quickly and accurate at the same time, or you are going to die. But these events happen not too often so it 's ok.Only moment yet, that♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me totaly off was that i lost a very nice person, i tried to protect, because i liked the person very much and was to me the most trustwothy one. It seemed she was supposed to die and i didn 't find any way to save her live....even worse, it seems she didn 't do anything wrong.All thumbs up!! I keep my eyes on tell-tale-games now!

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												The Walking Dead is a very good example of what can happen if the writing is good, the characters are strong and if the plot and execution of that plot is well done. You play as Lee Everette, a man who found himself stuck in a hopeless world full of despair and lost hope. Everything seems to suck for Lee, but then he found Clemintine, and then everything sucked a little less.See, Clemintine is the  definition of cute and she absolutely makes this game. She gives the player a reason to feel sorry and actually lets the player open up emotions to the people you meet along the way.This game deals with alot of mature themes like, drugs, murder, suicide,♥♥♥♥♥♥ etc.But the one thing stands out is the fact that there aren't many "happy" moments and that is perfect in my opinion because this game is depressing.... in a good way though.The story wa amazing and the writing was brilliant however, the voice acting could have been alot better. The art style in this game is very nice and gives you a sense that your'e playing a comic book, wich you kind of are because this game was based on a comic book. If you like the tv show then it's possible that you will like this too.The Walking Dead isn't for everyone since there isn't much gameplay but I would recommend that you give this game a shot since it really deserves your money

content:
Posted: January 24, 2014
												Amazing game. If you want a game with a lot of action this is might not be for you, as it is based heavily on dialogue.  While you'll still trigger the same events in the game no matter what your choices, it is still nice to play a game that makes you feel responsible for your actions. This is easily a must-have, even if youre not a fan of any other Walking Dead media. I only have 2 main complaints though people yet to buy this game should look out for.1. Technical issues. They happen, although most won't notice them unless they know it's coming.2. Full season. Basically, you can't buy 1 episode and see if you like it, then buy the rest. Instead you have to buy the full season. If it's on sale for $6 something this won't matter, buy it. If you're considering getting it for full price (Which it's worth) you should have a full idea of what you're getting into.But I digress. These are really only small complaints in what is easily one of the best games of 2012 and an essential to anyone who is looking for a good story where they truly affect the people around them. 9.5/10

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Personal Rating: 10/10This game is a masterpiece. I played the Xbox version and picked it up on Steam because the Xbox version was a bit iffy. This review WILL NOT contain spoilers by the way. The story is beautifully crafted, a truly amazing narrative as you follow the survival of Lee Everett and a whole host of different characters, from redneck man, old man and nerd man. This team of rapscallians take on the world of zombies, people and possible death by boredom. The graphics are fantastic, using a cell shading sort of thing almost like Borderlands did, it fit's the game perfectly, I can't imagine the game having a different sort of graphical style at all. The choices you make in this game are excrutiatingly difficult to make and do have an impact, whether it be choosing between two people or giving out food to someone. While it's been a while since I played the third, fourth and fifth episodes, I do remember the choices you have to make.Another thing this game has, is the fact that it's possibly the first and only game to have made me cry and feel emotionally invested to such a large extent. It's amazing how they did this and I commend Telltale for this.It's a beautiful game and for the price it's at, it's like stealing food from a survivor. There is quite literally nothing wrong with this game, maybe the occasional bit of lag or stuttering but other than it's truly, truly marvellous.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												T_T What a journey....Here's the game divided into segments.- Graphics 10/10Telltale using a comic style graphic design was the perfect choice for what it offers and it fits the mood. - Storyline 10/10Anyone who has played this game has had one of those moments where they tear up even just a little. The walking dead game was a joruney and a rollercoaster of emotions through out the whole 5 episodes. It has it's plot twists and a sad but beautiful ending that will make you want to try the season 2 of the walking dead which I suggest you buy. This game's story mode alone made the full price worth it.- Options 9/10I wish there would be more graphic options for the game and some more gameplay options but other than that it's good. Offers the obligatory subtitles option and plenty of options regarding hints and help.- Controls 8/10I had moments of frustration when I got couldn't move the camera to the way I was going and the keyboard controls in general in my opinion are weird. I definitely suggest using a controller for this one.- Gameplay 9/10As much as I liked the story the gameplay makes the game unique in it's own way and makes you want to play more of it.The choices you make in the game, the lines you choose, the people you trust make up the ending. There need to be more games in which you choose the path you take, will you go with the whole group or go alone? Will you kill this guy or walk away? It all matters, and that is what I like about this game. I expirienced a glitch at one point where I couldn't connect to the game even though it's a singleplayer game what fixed this issue was before clicking start upon launch I pressed Alt+Tab and it worked like a charm. - Final Verdict 10/10This is a must play game for everyone, I recommend this game for any gamer to try at sometime in their life.

												My first telltale game and WOW.. hard to express my feelings after just finishing the game.I like the cartoonish feel in their games and the stories are always amazing.There were times where I forgot I was playing a game, so ended up playing multiple episodes out at a time. Every aspect of this game is done so well (characters, voices, music, artwork etc) that when you get to the end, you will end up in tears.Huge powerful emotional impact that will leave you on the edge of your seat...Now off to buy Season Two!Sale or not, I recommend buying this game it's worth every cent. 10/10

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												This is an interesting game. The theme of zombies is overdone in the gaming industry but you don't get that feeling of "ugh zombies" in this game. You tend to think of it more as a survival situation. Although I didn't cry (most likely because I played the game over a time span of a day and a half) the bond between Clem and Lee is like no other. I felt an emotional connection to the pair especially when a certain soundtrack would play. It would remind me when Lee pushed Clem on a swing back at the dairy farm (traumatic flashbacks). I don't entirely like the art style although it definetly does set the game apart from others. Probably my favorite part is the decision making and the regrets that come after. It's fun to replay and see what different things can happen. Overall it's a pretty good game (aside from the random glitches...).

content:
Posted: September 20, 2015
												Cold, cruel, dark... how do I describe this game? No, this story? I just hope for one thing, and that is that no one has to ever experience the kind of emotional suffering involved for people in real life with real life decisions like choosing between lives to save or between your own welfare and your children's. No human should have to be forced to make those kinds of decisions. But that is exactly what this game forces you to do. Sure, you can stay silent during conversations, but you'll lose all respect.I played all five episodes, one each day, and I've just finished the last one. And I feel like I really don't want to play another Season. This game is not hard, it's brutal. I think about things like the apocalypse a lot, like what a world full of the living dead will be like, or a world where only you are alive. This game had me questioning, as I still do, the worth and value of human existence in times of prolonged suffering. Is there hope? Real hope? Or is that simply a mental mechanism to keep going and find a reason, however illogical, to keep living. What is the purpose of life, what are we living for? To raise up children, to just enjoy ourselves, to keep moving towards the inevitability of death? However unreal and farcical you may think a zombie apocalypse is, it acts as a compelling context for life questions.And not just that. It serves to seek out how we might react in a certain situation. Everyone has different personalities, and I'm sure you'd agree with me when I suggest that in this modern society, it's difficult to really know someone within a few days of meeting them. But when the world goes to absolute sh*t, there is no need for false impressions anymore. You can see people pretty square on. I had my brain in agony deciding, at times, what to say. I found myself trying to protect Clementine as much as I could. I realised her deepest desire was to see her parents, and I kept that in mind. I tried to save whoever I could. I saw people as humans, I saw them beneath their often capricious personalities (Kenny, Larry, Lilly - heh, even me sometimes). I tried to keep a level head all the time, and I guess that goes with my own underlying scepticism of life, held together by vocally agreeing with people who are good by their actions. I defined good as judging people not by what I or even our group needs, but by what the person being judged actually says they need. I could cite several situations, but I note this is a review, for those yet to buy the game.I'm glad, now looking at the game as a whole, that TellTale didn't do a 'Last of Us'. Not only is this game true to the comic book foundations of TWD, but it meant that more resources can go into making a fantastic decision-based story that feels so real and just draws you into it. Yes, you are not Lee Everett, you don't have his history, his family, or even his words (talking about the choices of dialogue you get), but it's close enough to identifying what kind of a person YOU are, because each dialogue option takes a certain philosophy and moral direction. Mostly, I was consistent, but sometimes, such as with Larry, I blew. I could talk a lot about what this game teaches you, or has taught me, but I must restrain myself, knowing not to let a review become an essay in philosophical thought.I haven't played anything like this before. It's different, and it's intelligent, and it will make you, yes, force you, to really think about what you say and do.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2013
												Хочешь отправится в опасное приключение по просторам зомби-апокалипсиса ? Тогда Добро пожаловать во вселенную игры The Walking Dead ! Только для начала стоит уяснить,что это не шутер в котором небольшая группа людей истребляет половину населения зомбированого Китая,а - это душераздирающая история о жизни простых людей в тяжелые времена,в которой суровый бородатый геймер плачит громче девченки после просмотра любовного сериала.Игра - настолько интересная,что даже не играя,а бесконечно нажимаю Q,я получал множество эмоций и адреналина.Тем-более это единственная игра в своем роде на ПК,так что проходить мимо нее однозначно не стоит,Клементина ведь обидется ...Плюсы игры :░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░-Очень интересная история :-Множество необычных игровых моментов :-Колоритные персонажи :-Комиксовый визуальный стиль,который придает игре определенного шарму :-Свобода небольшого выбора :-Клементина собственной персоны .Минусы игры :░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░-Немного однообразный геймплей игры :-Иллюзия выбора.Тут два варианта: полюбить историю и персонажей или клеймить игру за геймплейный минимализм.Я смело выбираю 1 вариант и с нетерпением жду второй сезон !Моя оценка игре : 9,5 из 10.

content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
The Walking DeadFirst of all, I would like to point out that many people have already written an excellent review about this game. However, after finishing this one I really felt the urge to let you know how I experienced this wonderful game.First ImpressionWell, as far as the first impression (~1 hour playtime) is concerned, I have to admit that I was delighted by the “cartoonish” texture and the “emotional depth”. I only expected and heard the best from “Telltale Games” but they somehow managed to surprise me.StorylineSo, now let´s talk about the story and the gameplay as such. Throughout the game you are playing as Lee, a convicted murderer. However, it might sound weird but I never felt any sort of hatred since the current problems (epidemic) are obviously far more important. As I already pointed out, you are Lee from now on and every following day might be your last one. The good thing though is that you aren´t alone. You are lucky enough to find Clementine, a girl aged 8 who lost her parents in Savannah. While Lee and Clementine stick together throughout the game some other “friends” you will make get lost or die, it´s all up to you. You don’t really have a final destination that’s why you are going to places where you expect to be safe.Choices“This games series adapts to the choices you make. The story is tailored by how you play.”As you might have already figured out that choices are fairly important in the first season of “The Walking Dead”, I would like to spend some time on figuring out whether choices modify your game completely. Well, I guess “Yes” and “No” is probably the most appropriate answer. You can pick one out of four different answers/reactions, which is of course and enormous variety. On the other side it doesn´t really change much. Let me explain myself with the following example: You have to choose what to do. Do you want to save a person XY our will you leave him/her behind? You have two totally different things you can choose from. But the story which follows afterwards will be the same for 100 per cent. You could argue that your decision you made is in some way really emotional and tragic but it doesn’t really change the gameplay. (I hope that was understandable since English isn´t my mother tongue. :/)GraphicsThe texture used is really unique. It´s just typical for all the “Telltale”- games. You can like it or hate it. (Well I guess that wasn´t really helpful but the graphic standards are really high nowadays which means it´s up to your choice. Look at some screenshots and you will know what I mean.)Mechanics (kept simple)Movement: WADSInteract: MouseChoose interaction: Mouse wheelPlaytimeNot only because of my lack of skill when it comes to Quicktime-Events (which occur regularly) but also some chapters I redid in order to figure out what would have happened if I had chosen something different it took me approximately 14.5 hours to finish this game.PriceI bought the game during the last Winter Sale but I think buying it for full price is also completely acceptable.Summary10/10A+Fantastic game for all type of gamers. I really recommend buying this game due to the emotional storyline and the wonderful graphics used.I hope my review was somewhat helpful. As I already pointed out, English is not my mother tongue so please keep that in mind. If you can give me any good advice: JUST DO IT.Mr.Visi0n

												Emotional and well-paced point-and-click adventure game with an excellent story. It's so immersive and touching, you might actually forget you're playing a game and think you're watching an episode of a TV series. The comic-book graphic style suits the game perfectly. Rarely can a game make you feel so attached to the characters. Can't recommend it enough.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												The Walking Dead has convinced me of the merits to episodic gaming. I found that the game stands by itself and that you don’t have to be a fan of the comics or the TV show to thoroughly enjoy this game. Although, it is really cool when you are a fan of the universe to get to interact with some of the characters that you know and love. The game allows for the player to make an abundance of choices that really do have an impact on how the game plays out. This leaves the player with the ability to go back and replay the game and have a completely different experience each time. This game has me hooked and I will definitely be playing the next installment.

Posted: April 4, 2015
												One of the most enjoyable, unique and impressive games I've ever played. It's emotional, epic, involving, fun and so in-depth with regards to the characters and the revolutionised choice-based plot.The way Lee comes across entirely depends on you, as does the relationship with the people you are stuck with/chose to survive along with you. Very clever and heart-wrenching. The final scenes had me welling up and the last time I did that over a game was, like, 8 years ago.I'd recommend this to anyone and everyone. If you want a standard 'run around and shoot zombies using two brain-cells' game then don't expect that here, but do expect something different and a million times better. It just should be exerienced.

I just hope for one thing, and that is that no one has to ever experience the kind of emotional suffering involved for people in real life with real life decisions like choosing between lives to save or between your own welfare and your children's. No human should have to be forced to make those kinds of decisions. But that is exactly what this game forces you to do. Sure, you can stay silent during conversations, but you'll lose all respect.I played all five episodes, one each day, and I've just finished the last one. And I feel like I really don't want to play another Season. This game is not hard, it's brutal. I think about things like the apocalypse a lot, like what a world full of the living dead will be like, or a world where only you are alive. This game had me questioning, as I still do, the worth and value of human existence in times of prolonged suffering. Is there hope? Real hope? Or is that simply a mental mechanism to keep going and find a reason, however illogical, to keep living. What is the purpose of life, what are we living for? To raise up children, to just enjoy ourselves, to keep moving towards the inevitability of death? However unreal and farcical you may think a zombie apocalypse is, it acts as a compelling context for life questions.And not just that. It serves to seek out how we might react in a certain situation. Everyone has different personalities, and I'm sure you'd agree with me when I suggest that in this modern society, it's difficult to really know someone within a few days of meeting them. But when the world goes to absolute sh*t, there is no need for false impressions anymore. You can see people pretty square on. I had my brain in agony deciding, at times, what to say. I found myself trying to protect Clementine as much as I could. I realised her deepest desire was to see her parents, and I kept that in mind. I tried to save whoever I could. I saw people as humans, I saw them beneath their often capricious personalities (Kenny, Larry, Lilly - heh, even me sometimes). I tried to keep a level head all the time, and I guess that goes with my own underlying scepticism of life, held together by vocally agreeing with people who are good by their actions. content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												I can't say it enough. GET A PROJECTOR!! It will change your gaming life!!!! This game was nice, BUT, it was so much better on my wall! Games like this one, Jurassic Park & The Wolf Among Us, with huge storylines and limited interaction possibilities would be better enjoyed with the picture as great as you can make it! Yes I have imported my decisions into season 2 (mass effect), I played the DLC, & am excited to hear of further upcoming seasons. The main protagonist, an african-american man, is a romantic, and easy to like, although he won't (can't) continue beyond this season. I am still getting used to the idea of playing a little girl (Clementine) in season 2. As a story, and played through the projector on my wall, I liked this game, HINTING that without doing that my enjoyment as much as I did now may have been reduced by HALF! So yes that big-picture made a difference! Nice.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
												This is the first Telltale game I have ever played, and it definitely was not what I expected.  Given their previous games and despite the subject matter, I was not expecting such a dark game but they pulled it off very well.  I can't think of any other game I have played that gives the player such difficult decisions to make and they do have a significant impact on the story later on.  The storytelling and voice acting is fantastic, as I would expect.Graphically, the game really isn't great.  It is styled to look like the comics, but many of the textures are absurdly low resolution for a modern game which hurts the visible detail.  It's passable though and not really the focus of the game.The gameplay is a bit of a mixed bag for me.  While I do like the innovative way they deal with many "struggle" events with a cursor that appears in a random place, the "mash button to do something" sections have been done to death in this and other games, and was never immersive, interesting, or good for your keyboard/gamepad.  I really hope season 2 isn't full of that as well.I am definitely looking forward to playing other Telltale games and I have a few on my list, if mostly for the storytelling.  Now back to dealing with zombies in season 2.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31
												Originally released as five episodes starting in April and ending in November 2012, The Walking Dead: The Game casts us as Lee Everett, a convicted murderer on his way to the big house. However, before Mr. Everett can trade his denim shirt for an orange jumpsuit, the zombie apocalypse breaks out and gives Lee new goals in life: namely, surviving at all costs and protecting a little girl named Clementine.It is these two goals that make The Walking Dead: The Game the juggernaut that it is. See, The Walking Dead is an adventure game, but it’s not the kind of adventure game you’ve come to expect. Sure, you’ll need to figure out how to get a radio working and how to distract walkers here and there, but the real draw here is a “choose your own adventure.”As you play through the five episodes, the big moments come when you choose how Lee responds to situations and what he says in conversations with his fellow survivors. Choices and dialogue pop up on screen with timers, and you have seconds to pick exactly what you’re going to do or say. Whereas previous adventure games from developer Telltale Games would let you run through every possible line of dialogue, that isn’t the case here. In The Walking Dead, you choose, and the game moves on – adapting its story to each decision.This is what makes The Walking Dead so special. You and I are tasked with the same goal of protecting Clem, but the way we do it might be completely different. I might choose to befriend someone you hate, and you might choose to leave someone I took. I might shoot my mouth off in anger, but you might keep your cool; either way, the group will remember that and the dynamic will change. The decisions you’re making in the moment have ripples that go throughout the entire adventure. When you get to Episode 5, the things you have and haven’t done – the choices you haven’t thought about since Episode 1 – are going to come up.Will our endings be completely different? No. The Walking Dead: The Game is telling us the same story and thus taking us to the same conclusion, but it allows us to experience it in different ways. I’ve heard some naysayers refer to this as “the illusion of choice” -- as in what we’re doing or saying really doesn’t matter because it all nets out relatively the same -- but that’s selling the journey short. The Walking Dead: The Game is like a coloring book: we each have the same black and white sketch, but it’s up to us to fill it in as we see fit. The relationships I’ve built, the emotions I’ve felt, the choices I’ve made – that’s what makes The Walking Dead: The Game so endearing.Part of that connection comes from excellent writing from the Telltale staff that manages to be funny, tense and scary at the right moments, amazing voice acting from Lee and Clementine, and a visual style that’s pulled from the comic book world the game is set in and that never manages to get boring. There’s this perfect storm here that manages to create such believable characters and set us in their world.When it comes to actually playing The Walking Dead: The Game, Telltale whipped up a new adventure control scheme. Like I said, for choices, text pops up and you have to jump on it, but for controlling Lee, one stick controls the character and the other controls an onscreen reticle you can use to interact with objects and people. When the action gets going and you need to shoot zombies or fight off walkers, it can be jarring to use the reticle stick to line up shots, but that’s part of the fun – the game catches you off guard with things and you have to scramble to the foreign control in order to survive.What holds The Walking Dead: The Game back from being a masterpiece are technical hiccups that have been well documented throughout the episodic adventure and are common Telltale stumbles. Scenes freeze as the next one loads, gameplay slows down as the game tries to process intense action, and save files inexplicably disappear. These are disappointing, but in the end, experiencing The Walking Dead: The Game is well worth any technical blemish you might have to sit through.While we have not encountered these problems, some owners of the Xbox 360 disc version of the game and Xbox 360 units without hard drives have reported stutter/playback issues. For information on how to fix that, see Telltale's support page.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2013
												A gripping tale of love, loss, and a whole lotta zombies, Telltale's The Walking Dead is a ride you don't want to miss. There are some questionable choices made, and certain story beats feel a little less fleshed-out than they could be (no pun intended), but overall I think TWD is an experience everyone should get the chance to play through for themselves. The art is exceptional, with a pretty unique style, and the sound is decent-to-great, but the main two pillars of this game are story and gameplay, and both are handled beautifully.The gameplay itself is a mix of quick-time events (which actually are pretty fun and usually exciting, and include some interesting variations on the norm), puzzle solving, and dialogue/story choices, and it plays out really well, drawing you into the story and letting you explore to find out more.The story is why you'll really be playing this, though, and it doesn't disappoint; it's a knockout. It starts fast and hard and only lets up to lead to the next big event, much like a good rollercoaster. Towards the end of the game, I felt that the locations stopped varying as much, but that's a small flaw in a bigger picture of neat locales and scenarios. The story beats range from sad, to interesting, to downright horrifying, but they're the most interesting when they're completely surprising. That's one thing: Some twists, for me at any rate, were easy to spot coming, but that didn't ruin my enjoyment of them. I really cared about these characters as I spent more and more time with them, and the way the story handles dark and grim themes draws you into the world and never lets you go.I'd hesitate to call it my game of the year 2012, but it's up there. Beautifully done, kudos to Telltale, and with a sequel slated for release later this year, there's never been a better time to experience The Walking Dead for yourself.9.5/10

Posted: April 16, 2016
												To begin, I don't play point & click style games, just not my thing, however... Being a fan of the walking dead, I've debated getting this for ages, and seeing it in a bundle, I finally gave in and got it. The gameplay itself isn't really exciting, the controls felt weird to me in a few situations, and the choices I made in the game felt really minor for the most part. As far as I can tell, my choices simply alter the relationships between the characters, with no significant impact on the stories outcome. That being said though, the story for this was truly amazing, and that's more then enough. If I were to sum up this game in a single sentence it would be...This is a must watch interactive movie for any TWD fan.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2015
												This was my introduction to the Episodic TV-show-like point-and-click genre and I was not disappointed.This is not a game in the traditional sense but more like an interactive TV show where you help the onscreen characters navigate a hopeless world. Pros Fantastic Compelling StoryTough DecisionsGreat CharactersGood ActingTime-limited decisions Cons Some weird camera mumbo jumboSome weird level design that has me looking in completely the wrong place for 10 minutes hitting the same 3 objects in a row. This gets really annoying when I know exactly what has to be done but the game won't let me because I have to do some weird superfluous action first due to weird level design. Overall This was a great introduction to a genre I didn't think I would like. Make sure you play with a gamepad as this game is best played on the couch with friends. If you haven't played any games in this genre yet I would recommend Life Is Strange first as that plays a little more like a traditional video game and is also better. This was a fun play-through though and is highly recommended.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												I can't say it enough. GET A PROJECTOR!! It will change your gaming life!!!! This game was nice, BUT, it was so much better on my wall! Games like this one, Jurassic Park & The Wolf Among Us, with huge storylines and limited interaction possibilities would be better enjoyed with the picture as great as you can make it! Yes I have imported my decisions into season 2 (mass effect), I played the DLC, & am excited to hear of further upcoming seasons. The main protagonist, an african-american man, is a romantic, and easy to like, although he won't (can't) continue beyond this season. I am still getting used to the idea of playing a little girl (Clementine) in season 2. As a story, and played through the projector on my wall, I liked this game, HINTING that without doing that my enjoyment as much as I did now may have been reduced by HALF! So yes that big-picture made a difference! Nice.

Posted: April 4, 2015
												One of the most enjoyable, unique and impressive games I've ever played. It's emotional, epic, involving, fun and so in-depth with regards to the characters and the revolutionised choice-based plot.The way Lee comes across entirely depends on you, as does the relationship with the people you are stuck with/chose to survive along with you. Very clever and heart-wrenching. The final scenes had me welling up and the last time I did that over a game was, like, 8 years ago.I'd recommend this to anyone and everyone. If you want a standard 'run around and shoot zombies using two brain-cells' game then don't expect that here, but do expect something different and a million times better. It just should be exerienced.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
												This is the first Telltale game I have ever played, and it definitely was not what I expected.  Given their previous games and despite the subject matter, I was not expecting such a dark game but they pulled it off very well.  I can't think of any other game I have played that gives the player such difficult decisions to make and they do have a significant impact on the story later on.  The storytelling and voice acting is fantastic, as I would expect.Graphically, the game really isn't great.  It is styled to look like the comics, but many of the textures are absurdly low resolution for a modern game which hurts the visible detail.  It's passable though and not really the focus of the game.The gameplay is a bit of a mixed bag for me.  While I do like the innovative way they deal with many "struggle" events with a cursor that appears in a random place, the "mash button to do something" sections have been done to death in this and other games, and was never immersive, interesting, or good for your keyboard/gamepad.  I really hope season 2 isn't full of that as well.I am definitely looking forward to playing other Telltale games and I have a few on my list, if mostly for the storytelling.  Now back to dealing with zombies in season 2.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1
												"First of the year" review! I wish everyone who reads this a nice and joyful 2017! Let´s start right into with something good, just like a positive review for an awesome game!What should I even start with? The Walking Dead is simply one of those games you can´t dislike. You just can´t.As you might have expected, I am a HUGE friend of story based games and this one is definately one of the best you can find among those. I enjoyed my time with it, more than with a lot of other games. As soon as I will have finished Season Two, I will probably complete the entire first season again, so that I can make different choices. I am sure every playthrough is an entire new experience. Despite the comic graphics, the gore is intense. Unlike many other Zombie games, there are no cutscenes and you are always focused on the events. Telltale tried to keep the comic style from their inspirators, but they created graphics so realistic that it´s frightening. Don´t expect from this beeing your average Zombie game. It´s not a shooter. Not at all. Unfortunately the gameplay is as boring as empty space, you wander arround, click on dots, search the screen for items and defend yourself by instantly pressing "Q", as this is the only thing necessary to pass the quick time events. In most cases you don´t even have to shoot Zombies, no, walkers, but instead run away, by holding "W"-key... There isn´t real music, except for the credits song, but all other sounds are great. Also the voice acting is fantastic, all roles are synchronized trustworthy, suitably pronounced and emotionally, at the right moments. English is the only audio language, so you should master it, but the subtitles are available in some other languages and the translation is allright, the few mistakes don´t matter.Storywise this is fantastic, the storylines make the game. I don´t want to spoil you any parts, but I promise you, you will like it. This game will stay in your mind for a long time. If you love stories, you must play this on your own. Don´t watch it anywhere, take part in it. The only thing that disturbs me are the achievements, of which only two require specific handling. All other are gained throughout progress. That´s a nice thing for achievement hunters, but I think such a game should either have achievments which require some effort or none. But "no effort achievements", as I use to call them, are in fact annother Telltale-feature, so we should get used to it.22,99$ is quite a lot of money, but they will reward you with 13+ hours of the best of intense, interactive, emotional and memorable stories in the history of video gaming. I wish everyone will think about this and not about the weak gameplay The Walking Dead has. With that said I want to thank you for reading, I´d like to ask you for a rating or a comment on how to improve my review and I hope all of you will have a nice year 2017; hopefully WITH playing The Walking Dead.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2013
												There's not much gameplay to speak of, even for a point and click game. Compared to others in the genre there is very little in the way of puzzle solving, instead being replaced with exploration and character dialog. In a sense, it's probably the closest thing you can get to a fully interactive movie and it's a damn good one too!As you try to stay alive after the zombie apocalypse, you are forced to make some tough choices, usually having a huge impact on the characters around you who, through some really fantastic writing, you really come to know, get opinions on and even appreciate.If you're looking for a game that will push and pull your emotions in all directions, and is also both highly polished in audio and video, look no further.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												The plot was unnecessarily too slow at times and that “you are not pressing the button fast enough” fake difficulty was annoying from time to time, but over all I enjoyed this title very much. The problem with this game became apparent when already at the DLC levels I restarted the game just to find that my saves are missing. After some googling I found out that this happened to quite a few people already and that TTG had no solution for it. Taking into account I played this way after  the release date I would expect such huge problems to be patched already.I would not recommend any game that messes up basic functionality such as saves, but for a game that is an interactive story that builds on your choices this is even bigger no no!Well at least this saved me some money as I'm not getting furtherer seasons :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
												The walking dead is a true adventure game. It is based off of the point and click mechanics of adventure games, but you do have some movement and control on your character. These mechanics work well, but they are not the highlight of the game. The highlight of the game is the story, characters, and the choices you will make throughout the game. Every choice you make determines how other characters react to you and whether they will help you or not in certain situations. The mechanic works exceptionally well, although, sometimes the story still feels kind of linear. The last episode would be the most disappointing in how your choices all merge into the same ending sadly. I know it is extremely disappointing when this happens, but I cannot complain since it is a small development studio and when pressed for time and resources, you can only do so much. I still highly recommend the game since it literally feels like another walking dead season! Pick it up and enjoy the amazing story!

The mechanics remind me of an improved point and click adventureStory-7/10You are trying to escape and find the girl you are taking care of's parentsMusic-9.5/10The music is mostly ambience, but without it the game wouldn't have any lifeOverall Creativity-8.5/10The story is kinda boring, but the gameplay is well executed.Overall Score-8/10Like Zombies? GET THIS GAME!

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												The Walking Dead is a game that is is for people that prefers the story to hitting things with fancy looking sticks. The game claims (and is not wrong in doing so) that the decisions that you make affects the story further down the line. These decisions can range from how to respond to what someone says to being given a situation where you have a good reason to kill someone and deciding if you want to do it. The choices you make will decide how people respect you and how willing they are to help you or listen to what you say.The Walking Dead is based off a comic book series of the same name, but you don't need to have seen it to understand the story  as you play as someone at the onset of the zombie situation who is having to learn how everything works anyway. You play as a guy called Lee who has conveniently commited murder just in time for a horde of zombies to eat the policeman driving him to jail. You meet a girl called Clementine and you two go off on wacky adventures to stay alive amidst a zombie apocalypse. You meet a variety of people and form relationships as you go off to find a more permanent place to hang out.The whole decision making mechanic is rather fun, however there are times where I choose something to say, but Lee says it in a different way than what I was expecting. For example, during a group discussion, Clementine wanted to go to the toilet and I said "Then just go", but I didn't expect him to be angry at her when saying it. This doesn't happen too much, but it doesn't help with immersion. I also like that the game doesn't focus on zombie killing, but rather on regular people actually trying to survive the zombie apocolype, involving rationing food and trying to find supplies in abandoned buildings.The Walking Dead doesn't go for realism in terms of graphics, but chooses to instead go for a comic book style of detail. This is probably good for this game as it could detract from the storytelling.I would not recommend it to someone wanting to just fight zombies or for a game with good graphics, but I would highly recommend it for someone who wants to play a game for the story it tells. If that is your preference, then this is worth playing.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2012
												Probably my all time favourite adventure game - despite its current, incomplete release. The Walking Dead thrives on its excellent storytelling and character-based narratives, which together, conveys a more realistic and believeable zombie-apocalypse world than any other Z-related fps. Each player experiences a unique playthrough, driven by complex, moral decisions that has different consequences, and will ultimately, influence their outcome of the story. This is by far, one of the most interactive games that allows a player's own personality to impact on their experience. It is in their interest to explore each chapter carefully, collecting clues / information about other characters / situations before making a decision. A masterful addition to the already superb repertoire of Telltale adventure games.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												This game is a must have.  Very good story, great characters (both main and side). A big part of it is the choices/actions feel real and really make you think "what would I do?". What really makes it stand out are the hard, hard choices you have to make and fast.  This adds to weight of your decisions and can sometimes come back to bite you (no pun intended).  On top of that this games finds just the right way to pull at your emotions adding even more to the outcomes of some decisions.I'm never really been one for "Point & Click Adventure" games but this one was a lot fun.  Also the art style reminds me a lot of Borderlands in the way it looks.  Another thing about this game is how they really tired to make the characters seem like real people who make mistakes and have faults.  Overall good game with a great story.***9.5/10***

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 11, 2012
												♥♥♥♥ing. Amazing.Alright, so to lay it out for you...On the company and their style:  A lot of people have been giving Telltale flack after how Jurassic Park was so heavily Quick-Time-Event oriented.  Understandably so.  Let me start off by clearing this up - This game is NOT QTE ORIENTED!  At all!  The closest it has is a few moments when you need to make a decision under pressure - if you don't decide fast enough it just makes something else happen.  Very neat aspect!On the Walking Dead IP and it's use here:   This is NOT based off the Television show.  That has NOTHING to do with this game.  This is set in the COMIC world with COMIC art style.   HOWEVER, it's a story that hasn't been told - focused on a character that we never knew.   That said, there are cameos and locations from the comics that are amazing to see as an avid reader.The game itself:   ♥♥♥♥ing. Awesome. Zombie. Game.  5/5.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2013
												The Walking Dead, as said by wikis and such, is supposed to be based on both the comic book series and the TV show. Being a fan of both, I really appreciate this games atmosphere and plotline. It an emotional rollercoaster with the occasional jumpscare here and there. The graphics are not much to ponder on considering its a classic 'Telltale Games' type. The story is well-crafted and not what youd quite think would turn out. As an addition to the game, the 400 Days DLC was also a nice little sidestory or introduction to these excess characters. I look forward to Season 2 of the game and happily await the TV series return as well.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2012
												The Walking Dead will take you through the real angst of a zombie apocalypse. No cool guns, no Rambos, just you trying to survive and protect those you love in the middle of hell on Earth. And thing can, and will, go badly.Based on the comic, this game doesn't bear share the same storyline the TV series does. As for the gameplay, there isn't much more than a few easy puzzles, action events and clicks, similar to Heavy Rain with less trivialities. Graphics aren't that poolished either. Music and sound FX fit well but aren't particularly outstanding. The strong point is the story, that's very well narrated and will have you immersed the whole 12-14 hours the game lasts, peaking during the ending.If you like zombie games and a good story, don't doubt this game is for you, 8,2/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2014
												The Walking Dead is kind of like one of those choose your own adventure books. Even though the story is quite linear, you must follow the path provided, the choices you make (via conversations) elicit different outcomes, so no two playthroughs are exactly alike.It isn't exactly challenging in terms of combat but that's not the point of this game. This game is just like being in the comic but you get to make the choices.The graphics rock.Soundtrack and ambient audio is awesome.Story and script are awesome, and 'realistic'.Had no glitches at all (which is rare).Really well fleshed out characters (but they shuld be, they've been in the comic for long enough)Bonuses: Problem solving in a hurry - yes, please! Tonnes of replay value!!9.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												The first time I played this game I didn't know what to expect. I initially assumed it was simply a horror game and went in completely blind, since even now I haven't watched the TV series.But don't let the fact that you haven't watched the show dissuade you from playing this game! I don't know if they link up to each other or not, but the game is totally playable to newbies of the franchise.The way the game plays out is that you constantly meet new characters with different situations playing out, in which you must choose an option or response to further the story.Although there are finite possibilities (obviously), you feel drawn in by these characters and situations in such a way, that you want to choose the best responses to each situation possible, to either help or hinder others.You are part of the story, and with stats at the end showing how you reacted vs others. It makes for some interesting hindsight.These actions you perform form a bigger picture in how things will progress later on down the line, some choices are more important than others, but they lead so far that they go into the second game.With the second game fully accessible to everyone now, this is as good a time as any to try this franchise, and see for yourself why it is a must-buy! Would definately recommend this game.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												If you want a game where you make choices that impact the narrative in a way beyond "you get +5 blue points and -5 red points and now you can use blue dialogue options", then you want The Walking Dead. Don't get me wrong- the major story milestones are set in stone.  But everything around them can change pretty dramatically, in terms of character behaviors, interactions, and some very impactful decisions.  You'll hit the big moments everyone else hits, but the whole journey will be unique to you and your decisions.The Walking Dead is an important game for the future of interactive narratives in mainstream titles, and you should play it.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2015
												After playing through this season twice (once on 360, once on Steam), I can definitely say without a doubt in my mind that this is one of the best, most emotionally compelling story-based games out there. If you want a ride of emotions, buy this game. The gameplay is sparse, but that's not what the game is about. The actual gameplay is based on you (Lee) making decisions that affect you and your whole party, leading to friends, enemies, conflict, and lots of death. Overall, the first playthrough is about 8 hours long and every playthrough afterwards is about 6 hours since you know what you want to do. If you haven't played this game and love a good story, buy it now, or wait for a sale. It typically goes for 75% off and it is more than worth it at that discount. Do yourself a favor and buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2015
												OK this game has 20000 reviews so I'll be short. As an adventure game amateur I was really blown away by the great atmosphere, the expressive characters , and the difficult choices this game give you, as well as the alternative endings. The story is really intense, even at times unrealisticly so, but mostly it's well orchestrated, there is a great story in this game.The story and genereal atmosphere and graphic is so great in fact that it might blind you to the flaws of the game. The gameplay in itself is really minimalistic, it's there but compared to the storytelling part of the game, it kind of feels anemic. The puzzles are very simple and\or obvious , and it feels like the designers didn't want anything to go in the way of the story. The quick time events with the weird q button are more annoying than scary, I have gone through the game but I still haven't figured out how it works. I kind of liked the action sequences involving fighting and guns but this was rather primitive as well.  Still it's obvious for me that a "the walking dead" serie is the future of adventure gaming, with atmospheric graphics, deep characters and convoluted storylines. However gameplay must be a part of it to really hit the spot, with real puzzles to solve.As it stand The Walking Dead is dangerously close to be an interactive story with different endings, nothing wrong with this kind of games especially when it's well done like this one, but I really think it could be more with some added gameplay especially in the puzzle section. With a little luck Telltales will deliver something like that soon, and we might just experience a new golden age in the adventure game scene...

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
 Story The story of The Walking Dead is the strong point of the entire game. You play as Lee Everett, a convicted criminal who gets a second chance at life thanks to a zombie apocolypse. While fleeing, he comes across a young girl named Clementine, whom he vows to protect. Throughout the story, Lee comes across a variety of characters, some of which want to help him, while others want him dead. It's up to you, the player, to decide how to handle these situations while the threat of zombies looms at all times. The plot of the game is it's selling point. Perhaps one of the most emotionally involved story in gaming to date, The Walking Dead makes you feel apart of the world by allowing you to play the role of Lee through voice dialogues and decisions. The game promotes the fact that every decision you make or every answer you give will have some impact in the story. Although this may not be true at all times, the story is still quite incredible. Play the game for this reason alone. Gameplay The gameplay of this game may seem very boring to some. The game mainly consists of prompts while talking to people or moving your mouse over objects and clicking on them. The occasional action seen will be a bit more interesting, but overall the gameplay is only a vehicle to deliver to story, don't expect anything addictive or innovative. Design The Walking Dead is made using a cell shaded art style, similar to the Borderlands series. It works marvelously, as it gives the game a realistic feel without appearing cartoony or arcadey. The environments and characters all look great, as do the zombies and the mangled corpses you come across.The sound quality in the game is phenomenal, which is to be expected in a dialogue heavy game like this. The only flaw I found with the design of the game occurs during some conversations and some action seens. Occasionally while talking, after inputting your selection, the game will skip over what the other characters are saying in order for Lee to say the line you chose. Also, during action scenes, occasionally there will be a jump between the animations once you make a selection, i.e. choosing to hit a crawling zombie will make the zombie warp to a position where you can hit it. These flaws are noticeable and can be annoying to some. Technical & Achievements Minus the hiccups mentioned in the previous section, the game runs very smoothly on the maximum settings. Thanks to the cell shaded styling, the game isn't very GPU heavy, except for some high action moments. The game provides a decent settings menu for graphics and audio, as well as options to remove the HUD. There is three save slots available so multiple playthroughs are encourage. Make sure to keep your saves in order, as they can be used for The Walking Dead Season 2 to continue your story.The achievements for the game are incredibly easy. You literally cannot miss a single one except for two in the 400 Days DLC which are easy to obtain. Some would say this is good as it does not detract from the experience. I would agree with those people. TL;DR - The Walking Dead is spectacular, whether you are an existing fan of the series, or simply looking for a story that will pull you in. I would recommend you also buy the DLC 400 Days as it adds more to wonderfully crafted world. Buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2013
												While not much of a 'game', it's more like an interactive story, I would still like to recommend playing The Walking Dead. Don't buy this game expecting an action-packed zombie survival game, because it is far from it. In fact, all the 'gameplay' in this game consists of clicking on specific items in the scene to inspect them or pick them up, point-and-click style. There are not even puzzles to solve and there is not really any difficulty in the game (which makes investigating scenes feel a bit 'slow' at times). Just try to get immersed, get emotionally attached to the characters, don't hate on the 'cheap' emotional manipulation and enjoy the story! Because, even though the story borrows serveral 'scenes'/ideas from the TV series and it isn't too original overall, it IS enjoyable enough to be worth the money (if you buy it on sale anyway..)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2013
												The Walking Dead Is less a game as it is interactive fiction, but that's not a slight but a compliment as you will feel truly involved in your characters actions, choices and destiny. There are elements of old school adventure games here and there with some puzzles and acquiring items, but generally your biggest weapon will be the actions you take and you will need to make the right ones quickly. The game is hard to explain to someone who hasn't played it, you can fully describe the mechanics but it won't do the title justice, it's one of those games you need to 'play' to fully appreciate its uniqueness and craft.The story and acting is top notch and impressive, you will feel drawn into it and it is on par with the series and my limited knowledge of the comics. Visually I'm not as big a fan, stylistically everything sits in a weird place between comic and cartoon and has a tendency to be at odds with the darkness of the narrative. The animations are also a bit janky having been key framed and manually done rather than captured, facial expressions sometimes being a little over exaggerated at times, looking almost Disney in execution. For such a brutal and honest game, it doesn't always gel and can distance you from the moment briefly. Overall though The Walking Dead has been really well done and I am tempted to go day one with Season 2. Telltale have shown they have the skills to deliver a substantial and well written adventure game, I am looking forward to their work with the recently announced Game of Thrones and Borderlands titles and will buy without hesitation based on their work here. While my game time on PC is short, I have completed all the original episodes on iPad bar the bridging one for the sequel 400 days. I am currently replaying on PC in preparation for Season 2 and exporting my save game over.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2013
												A grim adventure game which quite successfully mixes drama, puzzles and action sequences. Inspired by the Walking Dead graphic novel series, the game puts you in the role of a regretful convicted criminal at the dawn of a zombie apocalypse.The story is dark and goes to some depressing places, it's well told and bleak but with some lighter moments too. Each chapter of the story is and has its own focus, playing out very much like a TV series would. There's a larger overarching narrative, whilst each episode has its own core dillemma. Your choices in each episode have varying degrees of impact of the following scenes and episodes, with some particularly shocking moments and tough choices.I got about 2 - 3 hours out of each episode, for about 12 hours of total game time, which impressed me for an adventure game of this nature. The 'cinematic quality' of each episode improved as they went along, it felt like Telltale really hit their stride around episode 3, then start using some interesting camera angles and cinematic techniques for episode 4 and 5.A second 'season' is in production, so keep your save files handy.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												I opened a Steam account only to buy this game; the slippery slope I got into is a price I'd gladly pay once more for a game this freaking good.While built upon the oh-so-popular serie, the gameplay is anything but; a graphic adventure game which uses both dialogue-based and point-and-click mechanics in a way that surprises, you take the roll of Lee Everett: a survivor to the zombie apocalypse. From the very begining you find yourself having the possibility of, yes, point-clicking in the usual way of everything laid out for you, only to being suddenly thrown into a nail-bitting moment when the accuracy and speed of you doing so is the difference between life and undeath.And then you find what really drives this game: the choices you make when dealing with others. It might be something as easy as choosing day or night travelling, or something as tough as deciding wether to kill or perform CPR on a man who isn't clearly dead.This game is like a choose-your-own-adventure book on steroids; with many tough choices having only a moment (for there will be a timer, sort of like in real life) to be taken, you WILL think back to many of them, and wonder wether they were right. TWD will drag you into the story and push you such extremes you will both want to hit your monitor at times, while others you'll find you're at the verge of tears.Only reason I can think for not buying this game (other than being short on cash) is if you only like fast-paced games or care nothing for story (so fair warning). Of-freaking-course I recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2013
												[9/10] - A masterfully crafted piece of art. Telltale Games has delivered a phenomenal story, that's incredibly detailed and well thought out, and even emotionally investing at times. It's a dark and depressing story, but one with glimpses of hope that shine through like a beacon of light in the darkness of the world around you. This game tests your ability to stay focused and make tough, heart-wrenching decisions and even tests your humanity at times. It's intense one moment, and subtly peaceful the next, all the while making you wish you'd never have to really live life like that in the world they've created for you. Overall I was extremely impressed with this title, and it will forever change my opinion of point and click games. I'd recommend this to anyone who is a fan of Mass Effect, as this title easily climbs the ladder to be right next to it in terms of storytelling and decision making.

												The Walking Dead easily consumes you with horror and great storytelling. content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
												Excellent Drama, with a lot of holy♥♥♥♥♥♥moments. This is not a game you will play casually, it will surprise you, involve you emotionally and keep you on edge. It moves fast, thankfully there are no unnecessary  puzzles etc and everything is in line with the story. The characters shine,  interesting and memorable. The game's full of tough choices, you will be surprised at the decisions you make under pressure and it will always make you wonder if you did the 'right thing'. In a 'survival of the fittest' post apocolytic world, there is no right or wrong, it is just survival. Compassion is hard to come by and  it is each man for himself. Most survivors are alive, but would have lost their soul. It gives you insights into how quickly our civilized society could degrade into.. given a catastrophic situation. Great game indeed, a definite recommend to everyone. I am sure you will enjoy it.Rating: A+ (Outstanding)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												Wow. I went into this as a bit of a cynic, having found Telltale's episodic games very hit and miss. However, this series well and truly lived up to the hype. It's been a long time since I've found a game storyline so touching and engrossing. Well-written, generally well-executed and with gameplay which doesn't get in the way; indeed, the gameplay helps sell some story aspects such as an injury to the character. It's not a huge challenge in the sense of puzzles, but choices do have a significant effect on the story - which, given how engrossing it is, means a lot.There's a couple of bits which are a little too emotionally manipulative - the boy and the dog, for instance - and the final chapter is a little jarring, but otherwise it's an outstanding effort. Can't wait for the next season. Just one downside: be careful of a bug which prevents your choices from carrying over. It can be fixed (there are two preference files, just replace the old one with the newer one) but it's best to avoid having to go back too far.
